## [](#tag/line_items/operation/Update a Line Item)Update a Line Item

Updates the details of an existing line item. You need to supply the unique line item that was returned upon line item creation.

Please note, that request body must include the `id` attribute with the value of your line item unique identifier (the same one you passed in the URL).

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

event\_id

required

integer

Example: 1

Event identifier.

worksheet\_id

required

integer

Example: 1

Worksheet identifier.

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique line item identifier.

##### Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json

data

object (LineItemUpdate)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

**409**

Conflict

patch/events/{event\_id}/worksheets/{worksheet\_id}/line\_items/{id}

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/events/v1/events/{event\_id}/worksheets/{worksheet\_id}/line\_items/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/events/v1/events/{event\_id}/worksheets/{worksheet\_id}/line\_items/{id}

### Request samples

-   Payload
-   Curl

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "id": "1",              -   "type": "line_items",              -   "attributes": {                  -   "data": {                          -   "c1": "Painfully Amazing Product",                              -   "c2": 24,                              -   "c3": "items"                                           }                               },              -   "relationships": {                  -   "worksheet": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "type": "worksheets",                                      -   "id": "1"                                                       }                                           }                               }                   }       }`

### Response samples

-   200
-   409

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "id": "1",              -   "type": "line_items",              -   "attributes": {                  -   "data": {                          -   "c1": "Painfully Amazing Product",                              -   "c2": 24,                              -   "c3": "items",                              -   "c4": 0                                           }                               }                   }       }`

## [](#tag/bids)Bids

Use the bids API to query the bids in Workday Strategic Sourcing. Only bids for events of type `RFP` are supported.

## [](#tag/bids/Bid-Object)Bid Object

type

required

string (BidType)

Object type, should always be `bids`.

id

required

integer (BidId)

Bid identifier string.

attributes

object (BidAttributes)

Bid attributes.

relationships

object (BidRelationship)

Bid relationships.

links

object (ResourceLinks)

List of related links.

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "id": "1",      -   "type": "bids",      -   "attributes": {          -   "intend_to_bid": true,              -   "intend_to_bid_answered_at": "2020-01-02T03:04:05.000Z",              -   "status": "resubmitted",              -   "submitted_at": "2020-01-02T03:04:05.000Z",              -   "resubmitted_at": "2020-01-02T03:04:05.000Z"                   },      -   "relationships": {          -   "event": {                  -   "data": {                          -   "id": "1",                              -   "type": "events"                                           }                               },              -   "supplier_company": {                  -   "data": {                          -   "id": "1",                              -   "type": "supplier_companies"                                           }                               }                   },      -   "links": {          -   "self": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/events/v1/bids/1](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/events/v1/bids/1)"                   }       }`

## [](#tag/bids/operation/List Bids)List Bids

Returns a list of all bids. Only bids for events of type `RFP` are returned.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

event\_id

required

integer

Example: 1

Event identifier.

##### query Parameters

filter

object (BidInputFilter)

Filter bids by multiple criteria. Only one filter per attribute is supported. For best performance, we recommend 5 or less filters.

include

string (BidRelatedResources)

Enum: "event" "supplier\_company"

Use the `include` parameter to request related resources along with the primary resource.

page

object (PageInput)

Customize pagination results with `size`.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/events/{event\_id}/bids

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/events/v1/events/{event\_id}/bids

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/events/v1/events/{event\_id}/bids

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/events/v1/events/1/bids"

### Response samples

-   200

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Example

## [](#tag/bid_line_items)Bid Line Items

Use the bid line items API to query the bid line items in Workday Strategic Sourcing.

## [](#tag/bid_line_items/Bid-Line-Item-Object)Bid Line Item Object

type

required

string (BidLineItemType)

Object type, should always be `bid_line_items`.

id

required

integer (BidLineItemId)

BidLineItem identifier string.

attributes

object (BidLineItemAttributes)

BidLineItem attributes.

relationships

object (BidLineItemRelationship)

Bid line item relationship.

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "id": "1",      -   "type": "bid_line_items",      -   "attributes": {          -   "data": {                  -   "c4": 10,                      -   "c5": 10                               },              -   "updated_at": "2021-02-24T21:36:51.982Z"                   },      -   "relationships": {          -   "line_item": {                  -   "data": {                          -   "id": "1",                              -   "type": "line_items"                                           }                               },              -   "bid": {                  -   "data": {                          -   "id": "1",                              -   "type": "bids"                                           }                               },              -   "event": {                  -   "data": {                          -   "id": "1",                              -   "type": "events"                                           }                               },              -   "worksheet": {                  -   "data": {                          -   "id": "1",                              -   "type": "worksheets"                                           }                               }                   }       }`

## [](#tag/bid_line_items/operation/List All Bid Line Items)List All Bid Line Items

##### query Parameters

filter

object (BidLineItemInputFilter)

Filter bid line items by multiple criteria. Only one filter per attribute is supported. For best performance, we recommend 5 or less filters.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

# Workday Strategic Sourcing Fields API (1.0)

Download OpenAPI specification:[Download](blob:https://apidocs.workdayspend.com/1b2d69d3-36ab-47e4-83ef-b0663463df7d)

## [](#tag/support)Customer Support

We've provided detailed documentation below to guide you. However, if you need additional assistance, here's how you can get the support you need:

-   **Community Discussions:** Join the conversation on our Workday Community Discussion Boards (found under the "Collaborate" section in community). Connect with other users, share best practices, and get answers to your configuration questions.
-   **Expert Configuration Assistance (Professional Services):** For tailored, hands-on support with your specific project, our Professional Services team is available.
    -   Looking for personalized guidance? Workday Success Plan customers can submit an "Ask" for expert insights on configuration and best practices.
    -   Need custom solutions? Consider Expert Assist, our consulting service for detailed changes and project support.
-   **Reporting System Issues:** If you suspect a problem with the Workday system itself, please connect with our dedicated support team. Your company's Named Support Contact (NSC) can log a Product Support Defect case. We'll review the issue based on its impact and Workday's service level agreement (SLA).

## [](#tag/api_specification)API Specification

The API conforms to the [JSON API Specification](https://jsonapi.org).

The current version of this service is indicated by the `X-Api-Version` header.

Sample version header: `X-Api-Version: 1.0`.

## [](#tag/date_and_time_fields)Date and Time Fields

Our API adheres to the ISO 8601 standard when accepting and formatting Date and Time fields. All Date and Time fields returned by this API will be in the **UTC** timezone.

Date and Time fields sent to this API can be in any timezone, provided they adhere to the ISO 8601 standard.

## [](#tag/authentication)Authentication

The Workday Strategic Sourcing API uses API keys to authenticate requests. Every request will require all 3 HTTP headers:

HTTP Header

Description

**X-Api-Key**

a company-wide API key

**X-User-Token**

a user-specific API token

**X-User-Email**

user email

You can generate all of those from the _API tokens_ section of your _Profile_ page.

Your API keys carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secure! Do not share your secret API keys in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, and so forth.

All API requests must be made over [HTTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Secure). Calls made over plain HTTP will fail. API requests without authentication will also fail.

## [](#tag/rate_limiting)Rate Limiting

Rate limit windows are per second and are shared by all API Keys for a company.

The rate limit is 5 requests per second.

When request submissions exceed the limits, the limit-exceeding requests return `429 Too Many Requests` error responses to the client.

Upon receiving a `429` response, it is recommended to retry the request in compliance with the rate limit. One example would be to add a sleep function for 1 second and retry.

## [](#tag/field_groups)Field Groups

Use the fields API to create, update, and query the custom fields groups in Workday Strategic Sourcing. Custom field groups act as a collection of custom fields. Every newly made custom field with requires a custom field group (except for the fields with `target_object` set to `RFP`).

## [](#tag/field_groups/Field-Group-Object)Field Group Object

type

required

string (FieldGroupType)

Object type, should always be `field_groups`.

id

required

integer (FieldGroupId)

Field group identifier string.

attributes

object (FieldGroupAttributes)

Field group attributes.

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "type": "field_groups",      -   "id": 1,      -   "attributes": {          -   "target_object": "PROJECT",              -   "name": "string",              -   "position": 0                   }       }`

## [](#tag/field_groups/operation/List Field Groups)List Field Groups

Returns a list of field groups.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

## [](#tag/field_groups/operation/Get a Field Group)Get a Field Group

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Field identifier.

### Responses

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

## [](#tag/field_groups/operation/Update a Field Group)Update a Field Group

Updates the details of an existing field group. You need to supply the unique identifier that was returned upon field group creation.

Please note, that request body must include an `id` attribute with the value of your field unique identifier (the same one you passed in the URL).

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Field Group identifier.

##### Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json

data

object (FieldGroupUpdate)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

**409**

Conflict

## [](#tag/fields)Fields

Use the fields API to create, update, and query the custom fields in Workday Strategic Sourcing.

## [](#tag/fields/Field-Object)Field Object

type

required

string (FieldType)

Object type, should always be `fields`.

id

required

integer (FieldId)

Field identifier string.

attributes

object (FieldAttributes)

Field attributes.

relationships

object (FieldRelationship)

Field relationship.

links

object (ResourceLinks)

List of related links.

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "type": "fields",      -   "id": 1,      -   "attributes": {          -   "name": "string",              -   "target_object": "PROJECT",              -   "data_type": "string",              -   "type_description": "Short Text",              -   "position": 0,              -   "required": true                   },      -   "relationships": {          -   "group": {                  -   "data": {                          -   "type": "field_groups",                              -   "id": 1                                           }                               }                   },      -   "links": {          -   "self": "string"                   }       }`

## [](#tag/fields/operation/List Fields)List Fields

Returns a list of custom fields for the specified criteria.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### query Parameters

filter

object (FieldInputFilter)

Filter custom fields by multiple criteria. Only one filter per attribute is supported. For best performance, we recommend 5 or less filters.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/fields

Production Server

## [](#tag/fields/operation/Create a Field)Create a Field

Create a field with given parameters.

For fields with `target_object` set to `RFP`, `group` relationship should be omitted. It is required to specify the relationship for all other target objects.

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

data

object (FieldCreate)

## [](#tag/fields/operation/Get a Field)Get a Field

Retrieves the details of an existing field. You need to supply the unique field identifier that was returned upon field creation.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Field identifier.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

get/fields/{id}

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/fields/v1/fields/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/fields/v1/fields/{id}

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/fields/v1/fields/1"

### Response samples

-   200

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "id": "1",              -   "type": "fields",              -   "attributes": {                  -   "target_object": "PROJECT",                      -   "name": "Field One",                      -   "data_type": "string",                      -   "type_description": "Short Text",                      -   "position": null,                      -   "required": false                               },              -   "relationships": {                  -   "group": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "id": "1",                                      -   "type": "field_groups"                                                       }                                           }                               },              -   "links": {                  -   "self": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/fields/v1/fields/1](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/fields/v1/fields/1)"                               }                   }       }`

## [](#tag/fields/operation/Update a Field)Update a Field

Updates the details of an existing field. You need to supply the unique identifier that was returned upon field creation.

For fields with `target_object` set to `RFP`, `group` relationship should be omitted.

Please note, that request body must include an `id` attribute with the value of your field unique identifier (the same one you passed in the URL).

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Field identifier.

##### Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json

data

object (FieldUpdate)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

**409**

Conflict

patch/fields/{id}

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/fields/v1/fields/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/fields/v1/fields/{id}

### Request samples

-   Payload
-   Curl

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "id": "1",              -   "type": "fields",              -   "attributes": {                  -   "name": "Updated Custom Field",                      -   "type_description": "Short Text",                      -   "required": true                               },              -   "relationships": {                  -   "group": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "id": "2",                                      -   "type": "field_groups"                                                       }                                           }                               }                   }       }`

### Response samples

-   200
-   409

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "id": "1",              -   "type": "fields",              -   "attributes": {                  -   "target_object": "PROJECT",                      -   "name": "Updated Custom Field",                      -   "data_type": "string",                      -   "type_description": "Short Text",                      -   "position": null,                      -   "required": true                               },              -   "relationships": {                  -   "group": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "id": "2",                                      -   "type": "field_groups"                                                       }                                           }                               },              -   "links": {                  -   "self": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/fields/v1/fields/1](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/fields/v1/fields/1)"                               }                   }       }`

## [](#tag/field_options)Field Options

Use the fields API to create, update, and query the custom fields options in Workday Strategic Sourcing. Custom field options exist for single select and multiple select field types.

## [](#tag/field_options/Field-Option-Object)Field Option Object

type

required

string (FieldOptionType)

Object type, should always be `fields`.

id

required

integer (FieldOptionId)

Field identifier string.

attributes

object (FieldOptionAttributes)

Field attributes.

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "type": "fields",      -   "id": 1,      -   "attributes": {          -   "label": "string",              -   "position": 0                   }       }`

## [](#tag/field_options/operation/List Field Options)List Field Options

Returns a list of field options for the specified field.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

field\_id

required

integer

Example: 1

Field identifier.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

# Workday Strategic Sourcing Projects API (1.0)

Download OpenAPI specification:[Download](blob:https://apidocs.workdayspend.com/402e1aaa-6cdc-4a9d-a414-c54fdcb1ccb1)

## [](#tag/support)Customer Support

We've provided detailed documentation below to guide you. However, if you need additional assistance, here's how you can get the support you need:

-   **Community Discussions:** Join the conversation on our Workday Community Discussion Boards (found under the "Collaborate" section in community). Connect with other users, share best practices, and get answers to your configuration questions.
-   **Expert Configuration Assistance (Professional Services):** For tailored, hands-on support with your specific project, our Professional Services team is available.
    -   Looking for personalized guidance? Workday Success Plan customers can submit an "Ask" for expert insights on configuration and best practices.
    -   Need custom solutions? Consider Expert Assist, our consulting service for detailed changes and project support.
-   **Reporting System Issues:** If you suspect a problem with the Workday system itself, please connect with our dedicated support team. Your company's Named Support Contact (NSC) can log a Product Support Defect case. We'll review the issue based on its impact and Workday's service level agreement (SLA).

## [](#tag/api_specification)API Specification

The API conforms to the [JSON API Specification](https://jsonapi.org).

The current version of this service is indicated by the `X-Api-Version` header.

Sample version header: `X-Api-Version: 1.0`.

## [](#tag/date_and_time_fields)Date and Time Fields

Our API adheres to the ISO 8601 standard when accepting and formatting Date and Time fields. All Date and Time fields returned by this API will be in the **UTC** timezone.

Date and Time fields sent to this API can be in any timezone, provided they adhere to the ISO 8601 standard.

## [](#tag/authentication)Authentication

The Workday Strategic Sourcing API uses API keys to authenticate requests. Every request will require all 3 HTTP headers:

HTTP Header

Description

**X-Api-Key**

a company-wide API key

**X-User-Token**

a user-specific API token

**X-User-Email**

user email

You can generate all of those from the _API tokens_ section of your _Profile_ page.

Your API keys carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secure! Do not share your secret API keys in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, and so forth.

All API requests must be made over [HTTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Secure). Calls made over plain HTTP will fail. API requests without authentication will also fail.

## [](#tag/rate_limiting)Rate Limiting

Rate limit windows are per second and are shared by all API Keys for a company.

The rate limit is 5 requests per second.

When request submissions exceed the limits, the limit-exceeding requests return `429 Too Many Requests` error responses to the client.

Upon receiving a `429` response, it is recommended to retry the request in compliance with the rate limit. One example would be to add a sleep function for 1 second and retry.

## [](#tag/external_ids)External Identifiers (IDs)

The `external_id` field exists on many of the Workday Strategic Sourcing resources. This optional and mutable extension is intended to store foreign keys of the corresponding resource from a third party system. **These IDs are not considered Sourcing Data and may be logged in external systems. Do not include any sensitive or personal data in IDs.**

The purpose of external IDs is to:

-   Prevent duplicate record creation
-   Allow resources in Workday Strategic Sourcing and a third party system to share the same identifier
-   Allow for records to be queried or updated without requiring knowledge of the Workday Strategic Sourcing generated IDs

## [](#tag/pagination)Pagination

Paginated endpoints may return a subset of the total results for a `GET` request that returns multiple resources. Endpoints that support pagination will include usage details in the Query Parameters section for the resource.

The paginated results can be configured using the `page` query parameter to configure the number of returned results. The default pagination size is 10 results and the maximum pagination size is 100 results per request.

Endpoints that support pagination may return "self" and "next" sections within the "links" section that navigate to the current and next pages respectively.

### Example Paginated Request

#### Request Query Parameter Format

```
/projects?page[size]=25
```

#### Response Schema

The paginated response will also include the following schema

meta

object

Result set metadata.

links

object (PaginationLinks)

List of related links.

Copy

`null`

## [](#tag/filters)Filters

The results can be filtered to a subset of the total set of results using `filter` query parameters.

Endpoints that support filtering will include usage details in the Query Parameters section for the resource.

Most filters that end in `equals` support a Query Parameter array format to filter by multiple values.

Example:

```
?filter[status_equals][]=submitted&filter[status_equals][]=resubmitted
```

## [](#tag/projects)Projects

Use the projects API to create, update, and query the projects in Workday Strategic Sourcing.

## [](#tag/projects/Project-Object)Project Object

type

required

string (ProjectType)

Object type, should always be `projects`.

id

required

integer (ProjectId)

Project identifier string.

attributes

object (ProjectAttributes)

Project attributes.

relationships

object (ProjectRelationship)

Project relationships.

links

object (ResourceLinks)

List of related links.

## [](#tag/projects/operation/List Projects)List Projects

Returns a list of projects for the specified criteria.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### query Parameters

filter

object (ProjectInputFilter)

Filter projects by multiple criteria. Only one filter per attribute is supported. For best performance, we recommend 5 or less filters.

page

object (PageInput)

Customize pagination results with `size`.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/projects

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/projects/v1/projects

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/projects/v1/projects

## [](#tag/projects/operation/Get a Project)Get a Project

Retrieves the details of an existing project. You need to supply the unique project identifier that was returned upon project creation.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Project identifier.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

get/projects/{id}

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/projects/v1/projects/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/projects/v1/projects/{id}

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/projects/v1/projects/1"

### Response samples

-   200

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

## [](#tag/projects/operation/Update a Project)Update a Project

Updates the details of an existing project. You need to supply the unique supplier project that was returned upon project creation.

Please note, that request body must include an `id` attribute with the value of your project unique identifier (the same one you passed in the URL).

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Project identifier.

##### Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json

data

object (ProjectUpdate)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

**409**

Conflict

patch/projects/{id}

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/projects/v1/projects/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/projects/v1/projects/{id}

-   Curl

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

  "project_type": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "id": "1",                                      -   "type": "project_types"                                                       }                                           },                      -   "spend_category": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "id": "1",                                      -   "type": "spend_categories"                                                       }                                           },                      -   "creator": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "id": "1",                                      -   "type": "stakeholders"                                                       }                                           },                      -   "requester": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "id": "3",                                      -   "type": "stakeholders"                                                       }                                           },                      -   "owner": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "id": "1",                                      -   "type": "stakeholders"                                                       }                                           }                               },              -   "links": {                  -   "self": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/projects/v1/projects/1](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/projects/v1/projects/1)"                               }                   }       }`

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

required

integer

Example: 1

Unauthorized

## [](#tag/projects/operation/Update a Project by External ID)Update a Project by External ID

Updates the details of an existing project. You need to supply the unique project external identifier (the one you used when created the project).

Please note, that request body must include an `id` attribute with the value of your project external identifier (the same one you passed in the URL).

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

external\_id

required

string

Example: 1234-5678-abcd-efgh

object (ProjectUpdate)

  "custom_field": true,                              -   "data_type": "boolean",                              -   "name": "Custom Field Checkbox",                              -   "type_description": "Checkbox"                                           },                      -   "type": "project_fields"                               },              -   {                  -   "attributes": {                          -   "custom_field": true,                              -   "data_type": "number",                              -   "name": "Custom Field Decimal",                              -   "type_description": "Decimal"                                           },                      -   "type": "project_fields"                               },              -   {                  -   "attributes": {                          -   "custom_field": true,                              -   "data_type": "string",                              -   "name": "Custom Field Date",                              -   "type_description": "Date"                                           },                      -   "type": "project_fields"                               },              -   {                  -   "attributes": {                          -   "custom_field": true,                              -   "data_type": "string",                              -   "name": "Custom Field Select",                              -   "type_description": "Single Select"                                           },                      -   "type_description": "Paragraph"                                           },                      -   "type": "project_fields"                               },              -   {                  -   "type_description": "URL"                                           },                      -   "type": "project_fields"                               }                   ],      -   "links": { }       }`

## [](#tag/project_types)Project Types

Use the project types API to query the project types in Workday Strategic Sourcing.

Project Types are used in the project resource. On POST and PATCH related endpoints for this resource a project\_type\_id can be added to set the project type. The project\_type\_id is a foreign key for the project\_types resource's id.

## [](#tag/project_types/Project-Type-Object)Project Type Object

type

required

string (ProjectTypeType)

Object type, should always be `project_types`.

id

required

integer (ProjectTypeId)

Project type identifier string.

attributes

object (ProjectTypeAttributes)

Project type attributes.

links

object (ResourceLinks)

List of related links.

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "type": "project_types",      -   "id": 1,      -   "attributes": {          -   "name": "My Project Type",              -   "shortcode": "PRJA"                   },      -   "links": {          -   "self": "string"                   }       }`

## [](#tag/project_types/operation/List Project Types)List Project Types

##### Authorizations:

OK

**401**

## [](#tag/project_supplier_contacts)Project Supplier Contacts

Use the project supplier contacts API to manage project suppliers. This API provides 2 advantages over the project supplier companies APIs:

-   It allows specifying the supplier contact to be associated/removed from a project.
-   It allows specifying multiple contacts for a given supplier.

## [](#tag/project_supplier_contacts/operation/Add Suppliers using Contacts)Add Suppliers using Contacts

Add suppliers to a project using supplier contacts.

For best performance, we recommend inviting 10 or less supplier contacts in a single request.

[![redocly logo](https://cdn.redoc.ly/redoc/logo-mini.svg)API docs by Redocly](https://redocly.com/redoc/)

# Workday Strategic Sourcing Reports API (1.0)

Download OpenAPI specification:[Download](blob:https://apidocs.workdayspend.com/861bfd72-7f25-48a1-92e5-7bfa59de931f)

## [](#tag/support)Customer Support

We've provided detailed documentation below to guide you. However, if you need additional assistance, here's how you can get the support you need:

-   **Community Discussions:** Join the conversation on our Workday Community Discussion Boards (found under the "Collaborate" section in community). Connect with other users, share best practices, and get answers to your configuration questions.
-   **Expert Configuration Assistance (Professional Services):** For tailored, hands-on support with your specific project, our Professional Services team is available.
    -   Looking for personalized guidance? Workday Success Plan customers can submit an "Ask" for expert insights on configuration and best practices.
    -   Need custom solutions? Consider Expert Assist, our consulting service for detailed changes and project support.
-   **Reporting System Issues:** If you suspect a problem with the Workday system itself, please connect with our dedicated support team. Your company's Named Support Contact (NSC) can log a Product Support Defect case. We'll review the issue based on its impact and Workday's service level agreement (SLA).

## [](#tag/servers)Servers

A corresponding "region domain" should be used on every request. Please contact customer support if you are not sure which one to use.

**Note, our original domain `api.scoutrfp.com` is currently deprecated. Please switch to a new US region domain on or before April-2025.**

Region

Domain

**US (Default)**

[https://api.us.workdayspend.com](https://api.us.workdayspend.com)

**Canada**

[https://api.ca.workdayspend.com](https://api.ca.workdayspend.com)

**Europe/EU**

[https://api.eu.workdayspend.com](https://api.eu.workdayspend.com)

## [](#tag/api_specification)API Specification

The API conforms to the [JSON API Specification](https://jsonapi.org).

## [](#tag/authentication)Authentication

The Workday Strategic Sourcing API uses API keys to authenticate requests. Every request will require all 3 HTTP headers:

HTTP Header

Description

**X-Api-Key**

a company-wide API key

**X-User-Token**

a user-specific API token

**X-User-Email**

user email

You can generate all of those from the _API tokens_ section of your _Profile_ page.

Your API keys carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secure! Do not share your secret API keys in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, and so forth.

All API requests must be made over [HTTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Secure). Calls made over plain HTTP will fail. API requests without authentication will also fail.

## [](#tag/rate_limiting)Rate Limiting

Rate limit windows are per second and are shared by all API Keys for a company.

The rate limit _for reporting only_ is 1 request per second.

When request submissions exceed the limits, the limit-exceeding requests return `429 Too Many Requests` error responses to the client.

Upon receiving a `429` response, it is recommended to retry the request in compliance with the rate limit. One example would be to add a sleep function for 1 second and retry.

## [](#tag/versioning)Versioning

**Note**: The Reporting API handles versioning differently than our public APIs.

We release a new dated version when we make backwards incompatible changes to the API. So to be sure that the version used is consistent, we require it to be supplied in the request Accept header mime type `com.workdayspend.api.version` parameter.

As the JSON API spec requires to supply its mime type [at least once with no parameters](https://jsonapi.org/format/#content-negotiation-clients), the recommended way is to supply the Accept header as follows:

```
  application/vnd.api+json,application/vnd.api+json; com.workdayspend.api.version=2019-01-01
```

The next Accept header will be deprecated in April-2025:

```
  application/vnd.api+json,application/vnd.api+json; com.scoutrfp.api.version=2019-01-01
```

where `2019-01-01` is the current version.

There is `2018-04-01` version still available, which allows to pass given report id as a parameter (See 2018-04-01 Projects or Events documentation), however it might be depricated without a warning.

## [](#tag/pagination)Pagination

The list endpoints are paginated - the records are returned in batches of 10 by default. You can change this amount by passing the page\[size\] parameter that supports values from 1 to 100. If the previous/next page is available for the requested records, the `prev`/`next` key respectively has a value with a link to the corresponding page in the top level `links` object of the response. Otherwise, if the next/previous page is not available, the value for the corresponding key is `null`. So normally you would fetch the record with the standard URL and repeatedly fetch the next page till it is not available any more (which means that you have fetched all the pages).

## [](#tag/sorting)Sorting

The results of each list endpoint are sorted by its default sort value. You can override the sort value by passing the `sort` param to the request. Default and available values are visible in the documentation list endpoint section of each resource.

## [](#tag/including_relationships)Including Relationships

By default only the `id` and `type` of record relationships will be included. To include other attributes in the response, use the `include` parameter with a single value or multiple comma-separated values. An array of relationship objects is then available under the top level `included` key. Valid `include` values are noted in the documentation endpoint section of each resource.

## [](#tag/contract_milestone_reports)Contract Milestone Reports

This report returns a list of contract milestone report entries.

## [](#tag/contract_milestone_reports/operation/Contract Milestone Report Entries)Contract Milestone Report Entries

Returns a list of milestone report entries.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/contract\_milestone\_reports/entries

US Region

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/contract\_milestone\_reports/entries

Canada Region

https://api.ca.workdayspend.com/contract\_milestone\_reports/entries

Europe/EU Region

https://api.eu.workdayspend.com/contract\_milestone\_reports/entries

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     \-H "Accept: application/vnd.api+json,application/vnd.api+json; com.workdayspend.api.version=2019-01-01"
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/contract\_milestone\_reports/entries"

### Response samples

-   200

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": [          -   {                  -   "id": "1",                      -   "type": "contract_milestone_report_entries",                      -   "attributes": {                          -   "Scout-System ID": 1,                              -   "Scout-Milestone Name": "example 1",                              -   "Scout-Milestone Date": "2020-04-16",                              -   "Scout-Milestone Date FY": 2020,                              -   "Scout-Milestone Date FQ": 2,                              -   "Scout-Milestone Status": "Open",                              -   "Scout-Milestone Complete Date": null,                              - ## [](#tag/contract_milestone_reports/operation/Contract Milestone Report Schema)Contract Milestone Report Schema

Returns the contract milestone report schema.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/contract\_milestone\_reports/schema

US Region

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/contract\_milestone\_reports/schema

Canada Region

https://api.ca.workdayspend.com/contract\_milestone\_reports/schema

Europe/EU Region

https://api.eu.workdayspend.com/contract\_milestone\_reports/schema

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     \-H "Accept: application/vnd.api+json,application/vnd.api+json; com.workdayspend.api.version=2019-01-01"
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/contract\_milestone\_reports/schema"

### Response samples

-   200

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Copy

## [](#tag/event_reports)Event Reports

This report returns a list of event report entries.

## [](#tag/event_reports/operation/Event Report Entries \(Deprecated\))Event Report Entries (Deprecated)

**This report endpoint is only valid in version 2018-04-01.**

**It is deprecated and unavailable in subsequent versions.**

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**410**

Deprecated (2019-01-01)

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/event\_reports

Canada Region

https://api.ca.workdayspend.com/event\_reports

Europe/EU Region

https://api.eu.workdayspend.com/event\_reports

     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     \-H "Accept: application/vnd.api+json,application/vnd.api+json; com.workdayspend.api.version=2018-04-01"
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/event\_reports"

## [](#tag/event_reports/operation/Event Report Schema)Event Report Schema

Returns the event report schema.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/event\_reports/schema

US Region

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/event\_reports/schema

Canada Region

https://api.ca.workdayspend.com/event\_reports/schema

Europe/EU Region

https://api.eu.workdayspend.com/event\_reports/schema

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     \-H "Accept: application/vnd.api+json,application/vnd.api+json; com.workdayspend.api.version=2019-01-01"
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/event\_reports/schema"

## [](#tag/project_milestone_reports/operation/Project Milestone Report Schema)Project Milestone Report Schema

Returns the project milestone report schema.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/project\_milestone\_reports/schema

US Region

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/project\_milestone\_reports/schema

Canada Region

https://api.ca.workdayspend.com/project\_milestone\_reports/schema

Europe/EU Region

https://api.eu.workdayspend.com/project\_milestone\_reports/schema

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     \-H "Accept: application/vnd.api+json,application/vnd.api+json; com.workdayspend.api.version=2019-01-01"
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/project\_milestone\_reports/schema"

## [](#tag/project_reports)Project Reports

This report returns a list of Project report entries.

## [](#tag/project_reports/operation/Project Report Entries)Project Report Entries

Returns a list of project report entries.

**Does not support `project_report_id` parameter for the 2019-01-01 version.**

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/project\_reports/entries

US Region

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/project\_reports/entries

Canada Region

https://api.ca.workdayspend.com/project\_reports/entries

Europe/EU Region

https://api.eu.workdayspend.com/project\_reports/entries

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     \-H "Accept: application/vnd.api+json,application/vnd.api+json; com.workdayspend.api.version=2019-01-01"
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/project\_reports/entries"

## [](#tag/suppliers)Suppliers

This report returns a list of Suppliers.

## [](#tag/suppliers/operation/All suppliers)All suppliers

Returns a list of all suppliers.

**Query Params**

**Param**

`include`

Include supplier contacts with `include=contacts`

`sort`

Sort the suppliers. Supported values: `name`, `-name`, `created_at`, `-created_at`.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/suppliers

US Region

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/suppliers

Canada Region

https://api.ca.workdayspend.com/suppliers

Europe/EU Region

https://api.eu.workdayspend.com/suppliers

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     \-H "Accept: application/vnd.api+json,application/vnd.api+json; com.workdayspend.api.version=2018-04-01"
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/suppliers"

### Response samples

-   200

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": [          -   {                  -   "id": "3",                      -   "type": "suppliers",                      -   "attributes": {                          -   "name": "Hubschrauber LLC"                                           },                      -   "relationships": {                          -   "contacts": {                                  -   "data": [                                          -   {                                                  -   "id": "3",                                                      -   "type": "supplier_contacts"                                                                               }                                                                   ]                                                       }                                           }                               },              -   {                  -   "id": "1",                      -   "type": "suppliers",                      -   "attributes": {                          -   "name": "Schnappi Group"                                           },                      -   "relationships": {                          -   "contacts": {                                  -   "data": [ ]                                                       }                                           }                               },              -   {                  -   "id": "2",                      -   "type": "suppliers",                      -   "attributes": {                          -   "name": "Trippy Cow Inc"                                           },                      -   "relationships": {                          -   "contacts": {                                  -   "data": [                                          -   {                                                  -   "id": "2",                                                      -   "type": "supplier_contacts"                                                                               },                                              -   {                                                  -   "id": "1",                                                      -   "type": "supplier_contacts"                                                                               }                                                                   ]                                                       }                                           }                               }                   ],      -   "links": {          -   "prev": null,              -   "next": null                   }       }`

## [](#tag/suppliers/operation/Single supplier)Single supplier

Returns a single supplier.

You can optionally include the following query parameter to include supplier contacts in the response:

`suppliers/1?include=contacts`

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

supplier\_id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Supplier identifier.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/suppliers/{supplier\_id}

US Region

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/suppliers/{supplier\_id}

Canada Region

https://api.ca.workdayspend.com/suppliers/{supplier\_id}

Europe/EU Region

https://api.eu.workdayspend.com/suppliers/{supplier\_id}

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     \-H "Accept: application/vnd.api+json,application/vnd.api+json; com.workdayspend.api.version=2018-04-01"
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/suppliers/{supplier\_id}"

# Workday Strategic Sourcing SCIM API (2.0)

Download OpenAPI specification:[Download](blob:https://apidocs.workdayspend.com/1c04a002-7e67-4de5-b4b8-b19a6a5bbe53)

## [](#tag/support)Customer Support

We've provided detailed documentation below to guide you. However, if you need additional assistance, here's how you can get the support you need:

-   **Community Discussions:** Join the conversation on our Workday Community Discussion Boards (found under the "Collaborate" section in community). Connect with other users, share best practices, and get answers to your configuration questions.
-   **Expert Configuration Assistance (Professional Services):** For tailored, hands-on support with your specific project, our Professional Services team is available.
    -   Looking for personalized guidance? Workday Success Plan customers can submit an "Ask" for expert insights on configuration and best practices.
    -   Need custom solutions? Consider Expert Assist, our consulting service for detailed changes and project support.
-   **Reporting System Issues:** If you suspect a problem with the Workday system itself, please connect with our dedicated support team. Your company's Named Support Contact (NSC) can log a Product Support Defect case. We'll review the issue based on its impact and Workday's service level agreement (SLA).

[https://api.sandbox.ca.workdayspend.com/scim/v2](https://api.sandbox.ca.workdayspend.com/scim/v2)

## [](#tag/api_specification)API Specification

The API conforms to version 2.0 of the [System for Cross-domain Identity Management: Protocol](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7644).

## [](#tag/date_and_time_fields)Date and Time Fields

Our API adheres to the ISO 8601 standard when accepting and formatting Date and Time fields. All Date and Time fields returned by this API will be in the **UTC** timezone.

Date and Time fields sent to this API can be in any timezone, provided they adhere to the ISO 8601 standard.

## [](#tag/limitation)Support & Limitation

**The SCIM endpoints are limited to companies with SSO authentication only.**

Requests coming from companies without SSO configured will get a `403 Access forbidden` response.

## [](#tag/authentication)Authentication

The Workday Strategic Sourcing SCIM API uses a combination of HTTP basic authentication and a company token to authenticate requests. Every request will require 2 HTTP headers:

HTTP Header

Description

**X-Api-Key**

a company-wide API key

**Authorization**

[HTTP basic authentication](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication) of: user email and user- API token

You can generate all of those from the _API tokens_ section of your _Profile_ page.

Your API keys carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secure! Do not share your secret API keys in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, and so forth.

All API requests must be made over [HTTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Secure). Calls made over plain HTTP will fail. API requests without authentication will also fail.

### Example 1

```
curl --request GET 'https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/ResourceTypes' \
--header 'Accept: application/scim+json' \
--header 'X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY_KEY}' \
--user "${USER_EMAIL}:${USER_TOKEN}"
```

### Example 2

```
curl --request GET 'https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/ResourceTypes' \
--header 'Accept: application/scim+json' \
--header 'X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY_KEY}' \
--header 'Authorization: Basic ${Base64(USER_EMAIL:USER_TOKEN)}'
```

### Example 3

```
curl --request GET 'https://${USER_EMAIL}:${USER_TOKEN}@api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/ResourceTypes' \
--header 'Accept: application/scim+json' \
--header 'X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY_KEY}'
```

## [](#tag/rate_limiting)Rate Limiting

Rate limit windows are per second and are shared by all API Keys for a company.

The current rate limit is 5 requests per second.

When request submissions exceed the limits, the limit-exceeding requests return `429 Too Many Requests` error responses to the client.

Upon receiving a `429` response, it is recommended to retry the request in compliance with the rate limit. One example would be to add a sleep function for 1 second and retry.

## [](#tag/user)User

Use the users API to create, update, and query the users in Workday Strategic Sourcing.

## [](#tag/user/User-Object)User Object

schemas

Array of strings

URIs that are used to indicate the namespaces of the SCIM schemas that define the attributes present in the current structure

id

string

A unique identifier for a SCIM resource. It should be treated as a non-sequential opaque string of varying length.

meta

object (Meta)

Descriptive information about a resource.

externalId

string

Identifier of the resource useful from the perspective of the provisioning client.

userName

required

string

Email for the user

name

required

object (Name)

Name compound object

roles

Array of objects (Role)

Roles assigned to User (read-only). See section 4.1 of RFC 7643

active

boolean

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "schemas": [          -   "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User"                   ],      -   "id": "2819c223-7f76-453a-919d-413861904646",      -   "externalId": "701984",      -   "userName": "bjensen@example.com",      -   "name": {          -   "givenName": "Barbara",              -   "familyName": "Jensen"                   },      -   "active": true,      -   "roles": [          -   {                  -   "value": "company_admin",                      -   "display": "Company Admin",                      -   "primary": true,                      -   "type": "primary"                               }                   ],      -   "meta": {          -   "resourceType": "User",              -   "created": "2010-01-23T04:56:22Z",              -   "lastModified": "2011-05-13T04:42:34Z",              -   "location": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users/2819c223-7f76-453a-919d-413861904646](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users/2819c223-7f76-453a-919d-413861904646)"                   }       }`

## [](#tag/user/operation/List Users)List Users

Returns a list of users for the specified criteria. The pagination size is 100 results per request.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__basic\_authentication_)

##### query Parameters

attributes

string

A comma-separated list of attribute names to return in the response

filter

object (UserListInputFilter)

Example: filter=userName eq "jhon.doe@example.com" and meta.lastModified gt "2011-05-13T04:42:34Z"

An expression specifying the search criteria. See [section 3.4.2.2](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7644#section-3.4.2.2) of RFC 7644

startIndex

integer

The 1-based index of the first query result

count

integer

Specifies the desired maximum number of query results per page

sortBy

string

The attribute whose value will be used to order the returned responses. Allowed values are `id` and `externalId`

sortOrder

string

Order in which the `sortBy` param is applied. Allowed values are `ascending` and `descending`

### Responses

**200**

OK

**400**

Parameter count exceeds the maximum allowed value or the filter supplied was unparsable

get/Users

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users

### Response samples

-   200
-   400

Content type

application/scim+json

  {                  -   "userName": "john.doe@example.com",                      -   "name": {                          -   "givenName": "John",                              -   "familyName": "Doe"                                           },                      - required

Email for the user

name

required

object (Name)

Name compound object

active

boolean

### Responses

**201**

OK

**400**

An invalid value was passed in the payload

**409**

There is a conflict with an already existing user. Uniqueness is assumed over userName

## [](#tag/user/operation/Patch a User)Patch a User

Updates one or more attributes of a User resource using a sequence of additions, removals, and replacements operations. See [section 3.5.2](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7644#section-3.5.2) of RFC 7644.

If the user tries to deactivate themselves, they will get a `403 Access forbidden` response.

Operations on the `userName` field will only be processed if both original and target email addresses match the domains list set for the Company's SSO connections.

If not, the response returned will be a `403 Access forbidden`.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__basic\_authentication_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

string

##### query Parameters

attributes

string

A comma-separated list of attribute names to return in the response

##### Request Body schema: application/scim+json

required

Payload describing the patch operations to apply upon the resource identified by param id

schemas

Array of strings

Operations

required

Array of objects (PatchOperation)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**400**

One or more operations supplied in the request are specified incorrectly, there were attempts to modify immutable attributes, or the resulting resource cannot pass intrinsic validations

**403**

Access Forbidden

**404**

Not Found

patch/Users/{id}

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users/{id}

### Request samples

-   Payload

Content type

application/scim+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "schemas": [          -   "urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:PatchOp"                   ],      -   "Operations": [          -   {                  -   "op": "replace",                      -   "value": {                          -   "externalId": "EXT701984",                              -   "name": {                                  -   "familyName": "Johnson"                                                       }                                           }                               }                   ]       }`

### Response samples

-   200
-   400
-   403
-   404

Content type

application/scim+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "schemas": [          -   "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User"                   ],      -   "id": "2819c223-7f76-453a-919d-413861904646",      -   "externalId": "EXT701984",      -   "userName": "bjensen@example.com",      -   "name": {          -   "givenName": "Barbara",              -   "familyName": "Johnson"                   },      -   "active": true,      -   "roles": [          -   {                  -   "value": "company_admin",                      -   "display": "Company Admin",                      -   "primary": true,                      -   "type": "primary"                               }                   ],      -   "meta": {          -   "resourceType": "User",              -   "created": "2010-01-23T04:56:22Z",              -   "lastModified": "2011-06-13T04:42:34Z",              -   "location": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users/2819c223-7f76-453a-919d-413861904646](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users/2819c223-7f76-453a-919d-413861904646)"                   }       }`

## [](#tag/user/operation/Replace a User)Replace a User

Updates a User resource (see [section 3.5.1](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7644#section-3.5.1) of RFC 7644). Update works in a replacement fashion; every attribute value found in the payload sent will replace the one in the existing resource representation. Attributes not passed in the payload will be left intact.

If the user tries to deactivate themselves, they will get a `403 Access forbidden` response.

Operations on the `userName` field will only be processed if both original and target email addresses match the domains list set for the Company's SSO connections.

If not, the response returned will be a `403 Access forbidden`.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__basic\_authentication_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

string

##### query Parameters

attributes

string

A comma-separated list of attribute names to return in the response

##### Request Body schema: application/scim+json

required

Payload with the data to replace in the existing user identified by the id param

externalId

string

Identifier of the resource useful from the perspective of the provisioning client.

userName

required

string

Email for the user

name

required

object (Name)

Name compound object

active

boolean

### Responses

**200**

OK

**400**

An invalid value was passed in the payload or there was an attempt to update an immutable attribute

**403**

Access Forbidden

**404**

Not Found

**409**

There is a conflict with an already existing user.

put/Users/{id}

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users/{id}

### Request samples

-   Payload

Content type

application/scim+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "schemas": [          -   "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User"                   ],      -   "externalId": "EXT701984",      -   "userName": "bjensen@example.com",      -   "name": {          -   "givenName": "Barbara",              -   "familyName": "Johnson"                   },      -   "active": true       }`

### Response samples

-   200
-   400
-   403
-   404
-   409

Content type

application/scim+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "schemas": [          -   "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User"                   ],      -   "id": "2819c223-7f76-453a-919d-413861904646",      -   "externalId": "EXT701984",      -   "userName": "bjensen@example.com",      -   "name": {          -   "givenName": "Barbara",              -   "familyName": "Johnson"                   },      -   "active": true,      -   "roles": [          -   {                  -   "value": "company_admin",                      -   "display": "Company Admin",                      -   "primary": true,                      -   "type": "primary"                               }                   ],      -   "meta": {          -   "resourceType": "User",              -   "created": "2010-01-23T04:56:22Z",              -   "lastModified": "2011-06-13T04:42:34Z",              -   "location": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users/2819c223-7f76-453a-919d-413861904646](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users/2819c223-7f76-453a-919d-413861904646)"                   }       }`

## [](#tag/user/operation/Deactivate a user)Deactivate a user

Deactivates a user. You need to supply the unique user identifier that was returned upon user creation.

If the user tries to deactivate themselves, they will get a `403 Access forbidden` response.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__basic\_authentication_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

string

Identifier of the resource to deactivate

### Responses

**204**

OK

**403**

Access Forbidden

**404**

Not Found

delete/Users/{id}

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Users/{id}

### Response samples

-   403
-   404

Content type

application/scim+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "value": {          -   "schemas": [                  -   "urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"                               ],              -   "status": "403",              -   "detail": "Access forbidden"                   }       }`

## [](#tag/discovery)Discovery

Endpoints to facilitate discovery of SCIM service provider features

## [](#tag/discovery/operation/List Schemas)List Schemas

Endpoint used to retrieve information about schemas supported. See [section 3.4](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7644#section-3.4) of RFC 7644

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__basic\_authentication_)

### Responses

**200**

OK

get/Schemas

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Schemas

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Schemas

-   200

## [](#tag/discovery/operation/Get a Schema)Get a Schema

Retrieves information about a specific resource

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__basic\_authentication_)

##### path Parameters

uri

required

string

Value: "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User"

Schema URI of a particular resource type

### Responses

**200**

OK

**404**

Not Found

get/Schemas/{uri}

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Schemas/{uri}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/Schemas/{uri}

### Response samples

-   200
-   404

Content type

application/scim+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "name": "User",      -   "id": "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User",      -   "description": "Represents a User",      -   "meta": {          -   "resourceType": "Schema",              -   "location": "/scim/v2/Schemas?name=urn%3Aietf%3Aparams%3Ascim%3Aschemas%3Acore%3A2.0%3AUser"                   },      -   "attributes": [          -   {                  -   "multiValued": false,                      -   "required": false,                      -   "caseExact": false,                      -   "mutability": "readOnly",                      -   "uniqueness": "server",                      -   "returned": "always",                      -   "name": "id",                      -   "type": "string"                               },              -   {                  -   "multiValued": false,                      -   "required": false,                      -   "caseExact": false,                      -   "mutability": "readWrite",                      -   "uniqueness": "none",                      -   "returned": "default",                      -   "name": "externalId",                      - ## [](#tag/discovery/operation/List Resource Types)List Resource Types

This endpoint is used to discover the types of resources available (see [section 4](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7644#section-4) of RFC 7644)

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__basic\_authentication_)

### Responses

**200**

OK

get/ResourceTypes

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/ResourceTypes

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/ResourceTypes

### Response samples

-   200

Content type

application/scim+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "schemas": [          -   "urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:ListResponse"                   ],      -   "totalResults": 1,      -   "startIndex": 0,      -   "itemsPerPage": 100,      -   "Resources": [          -   {                  -   "meta": {                          -   "resourceType": "ResourceType",                              -   "location": "/scim/v2/ResourceTypes/User"                                           },                      -   "schemas": [                          -   "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:ResourceType"                                           ],                      -   "endpoint": "/Users",                      -   "schema": "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User",                      -   "id": "User",                      -   "name": "User"                               }                   ]       }`

## [](#tag/discovery/operation/Get a Resource Type)Get a Resource Type

Describes the endpoint, schemas and extensions supported by a specific kind of resource. It returns a specific portion of the ouput of the more general /Resources endpoint

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__basic\_authentication_)

##### path Parameters

resource

required

string

Value: "User"

### Responses

**200**

OK

get/ResourceTypes/{resource}

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/ResourceTypes/{resource}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/ResourceTypes/{resource}

### Response samples

-   200

Content type

application/scim+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "meta": {          -   "resourceType": "ResourceType",              -   "location": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/ResourceTypes/User](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/ResourceTypes/User)"                   },      -   "schemas": [          -   "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:ResourceType"                   ],      -   "endpoint": "/Users",      -   "schema": "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User",      -   "id": "User",      -   "name": "User"       }`

## [](#tag/discovery/operation/List Service Provider Configs)List Service Provider Configs

Describes the SCIM specification features available (see [section 5](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7643#section-5) of RFC 7643)

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__basic\_authentication_)

### Responses

**200**

OK

get/ServiceProviderConfig

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/ServiceProviderConfig

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/ServiceProviderConfig

### Response samples

-   200

Content type

application/scim+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "bulk": {          -   "supported": false                   },      -   "changePassword": {          -   "supported": false                   },      -   "sort": {          -   "supported": true                   },      -   "etag": {          -   "supported": false                   },      -   "patch": {          -   "supported": true                   },      -   "filter": {          -   "supported": true,              -   "maxResults": 100                   },      -   "schemas": [          -   "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:ServiceProviderConfig"                   ],      -   "meta": {          -   "resourceType": "ServiceProviderConfig",              -   "created": "2021-07-27T13:24:01.182+01:00",              -   "lastModified": "2021-07-27T13:24:01.182+01:00",              -   "version": "1",              -   "location": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/ServiceProviderConfig](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/scim/v2/ServiceProviderConfig)"                   },      -   "authenticationSchemes": [          -   {                  -   "type": "httpbasic",                      -   "name": "HTTP Basic",                      -   "description": "Authentication scheme using the HTTP Basic Standard"                               }                   ]       }`

        -   postCreate a Spend Category
        -   getGet a Spend Category

        -   delDelete a Spend Category
        -   getGet a Spend Category by External ID
        -   patchUpdate a Spend Category by External ID
        -   delDelete a Spend Category by External ID

# Workday Strategic Sourcing Spend Categories API (1.0)

Download OpenAPI specification:[Download](blob:https://apidocs.workdayspend.com/8618bd41-7e45-432c-b2f6-107b63901f27)

## [](#tag/support)Customer Support

We've provided detailed documentation below to guide you. However, if you need additional assistance, here's how you can get the support you need:

-   **Community Discussions:** Join the conversation on our Workday Community Discussion Boards (found under the "Collaborate" section in community). Connect with other users, share best practices, and get answers to your configuration questions.
-   **Expert Configuration Assistance (Professional Services):** For tailored, hands-on support with your specific project, our Professional Services team is available.
    -   Looking for personalized guidance? Workday Success Plan customers can submit an "Ask" for expert insights on configuration and best practices.
    -   Need custom solutions? Consider Expert Assist, our consulting service for detailed changes and project support.
-   **Reporting System Issues:** If you suspect a problem with the Workday system itself, please connect with our dedicated support team. Your company's Named Support Contact (NSC) can log a Product Support Defect case. We'll review the issue based on its impact and Workday's service level agreement (SLA).

## [](#tag/servers)Servers

### US Region

Environment

US region Base URI

**Production**

[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend\_categories/v1](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend_categories/v1)

**Sandbox**

[https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend\_categories/v1](https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend_categories/v1)
