**Sandbox**

[https://api.sandbox.ca.workdayspend.com/services/spend\_categories/v1](https://api.sandbox.ca.workdayspend.com/services/spend_categories/v1)

## [](#tag/api_specification)API Specification

The API conforms to the [JSON API Specification](https://jsonapi.org).

The current version of this service is indicated by the `X-Api-Version` header.

Sample version header: `X-Api-Version: 1.0`.

## [](#tag/date_and_time_fields)Date and Time Fields

Our API adheres to the ISO 8601 standard when accepting and formatting Date and Time fields. All Date and Time fields returned by this API will be in the **UTC** timezone.

Date and Time fields sent to this API can be in any timezone, provided they adhere to the ISO 8601 standard.

## [](#tag/authentication)Authentication

The Workday Strategic Sourcing API uses API keys to authenticate requests. Every request will require all 3 HTTP headers:

HTTP Header

Description

**X-Api-Key**

a company-wide API key

**X-User-Token**

a user-specific API token

**X-User-Email**

user email

You can generate all of those from the _API tokens_ section of your _Profile_ page.

Your API keys carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secure! Do not share your secret API keys in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, and so forth.

All API requests must be made over [HTTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Secure). Calls made over plain HTTP will fail. API requests without authentication will also fail.

## [](#tag/rate_limiting)Rate Limiting

Rate limit windows are per second and are shared by all API Keys for a company.

The rate limit is 5 requests per second.

When request submissions exceed the limits, the limit-exceeding requests return `429 Too Many Requests` error responses to the client.

Upon receiving a `429` response, it is recommended to retry the request in compliance with the rate limit. One example would be to add a sleep function for 1 second and retry.

## [](#tag/external_ids)External Identifiers (IDs)

The `external_id` field exists on many of the Workday Strategic Sourcing resources. This optional and mutable extension is intended to store foreign keys of the corresponding resource from a third party system. **These IDs are not considered Sourcing Data and may be logged in external systems. Do not include any sensitive or personal data in IDs.**

The purpose of external IDs is to:

-   Prevent duplicate record creation
-   Allow resources in Workday Strategic Sourcing and a third party system to share the same identifier
-   Allow for records to be queried or updated without requiring knowledge of the Workday Strategic Sourcing generated IDs

## [](#tag/pagination)Pagination

Paginated endpoints may return a subset of the total results for a `GET` request that returns multiple resources. Endpoints that support pagination will include usage details in the Query Parameters section for the resource.

The paginated results can be configured using the `page` query parameter to configure the number of returned results. The default pagination size is 10 results and the maximum pagination size is 100 results per request.

Endpoints that support pagination may return "self" and "next" sections within the "links" section that navigate to the current and next pages respectively.

### Example Paginated Request

#### Request Query Parameter Format

```
/projects?page[size]=25
```

#### Response Schema

The paginated response will also include the following schema

meta

object

Result set metadata.

links

object (PaginationLinks)

List of related links.

Copy

`null`

## [](#tag/filters)Filters

The results can be filtered to a subset of the total set of results using `filter` query parameters.

Endpoints that support filtering will include usage details in the Query Parameters section for the resource.

Most filters that end in `equals` support a Query Parameter array format to filter by multiple values.

Example:

```
?filter[status_equals][]=submitted&filter[status_equals][]=resubmitted
```

## [](#tag/spend_categories)Spend Categories

Use the Spend Categories API to create, update, and query the Spend Categories in Workday Strategic Sourcing.

Spend Categories are used in both the project and contract resources. On POST and PATCH related endpoints for those resources a spend\_category\_id can be added to attach a spend category. The spend\_category\_id is a foreign key for the spend\_categories resource's id.

## [](#tag/spend_categories/Spend-Category-Object)Spend Category Object

type

string (SpendCategoryType)

Object type, should always be `spend_categories`.

id

required

integer (SpendCategoryId)

Spend category identifier string.

attributes

object (SpendCategoryAttributes)

Spend category attributes.

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "type": "spend_categories",      -   "id": 1,      -   "attributes": {          -   "name": "string",              -   "external_id": "string",              -   "usages": [                  -   "procurement"                               ]                   }       }`

## [](#tag/spend_categories/operation/List Spend Categories)List Spend Categories

Returns a list of spend categories.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/spend\_categories

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend\_categories/v1/spend\_categories

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend\_categories/v1/spend\_categories

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend\_categories/v1/spend\_categories"

### Response samples

-   200

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "meta": {          -   "count": 2                   },      -   "data": [          -   {                  -   "type": "spend_categories",                      -   "id": "1",                      -   "attributes": {                          -   "name": "Spend Category #1",                              -   "external_id": "SP-1",                              -   "usages": [                                  -   "procurement"                                                       ]                                           },                      -   "links": {                          -   "self": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend_categories/v1/spend_categories/1](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend_categories/v1/spend_categories/1)"                                           }                               },              -   "links": {          -   "self": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend_categories/v1/spend_categories?page%5Bsize%5D=10](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend_categories/v1/spend_categories?page%255Bsize%255D=10)",              -   "next": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend_categories/v1/spend_categories?page%5Bcursor%5D=WzJd&page%5Bdirection%5D=next&page%5Bsize%5D=10](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend_categories/v1/spend_categories?page%255Bcursor%255D=WzJd&page%255Bdirection%255D=next&page%255Bsize%255D=10)",              -   "prev": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend_categories/v1/spend_categories?page%5Bcursor%5D=WzFd&page%5Bdirection%5D=prev&page%5Bsize%5D=10](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend_categories/v1/spend_categories?page%255Bcursor%255D=WzFd&page%255Bdirection%255D=prev&page%255Bsize%255D=10)"                   }       }`

## [](#tag/spend_categories/operation/Update a Spend Category)Update a Spend Category

Updates the details of an existing Spend Category. You need to supply the unique identifier that was returned upon Spend Category creation.

Please note, that request body must include an `id` attribute with the value of your Spend Category unique identifier (the same one you passed in the URL).

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Spend Category identifier.

##### Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json

data

object (SpendCategoryUpdate)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

**409**

Conflict

patch/spend\_categories/{id}

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend\_categories/v1/spend\_categories/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend\_categories/v1/spend\_categories/{id}

### Request samples

-   Payload
-   Curl

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "type": "spend_categories",              -   "id": "1",              -   "attributes": {                  -   "name": "Spend Category Updated",                      -   "external_id": "SP-UPD",                      -   "usages": [                          -   "procurement"                                           ]                               }                   }       }`

### Response samples

-   200
-   409

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "id": "1",              -   "type": "spend_categories",              -   "attributes": {                  -   "name": "Spend Category Updated",                      -   "external_id": "SP-UPD",                      -   "usages": [                          -   "procurement"                                           ]                               },              -   "links": {                  -   "self": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend_categories/v1/spend_categories/1](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend_categories/v1/spend_categories/1)"                               }                   }       }`

## [](#tag/spend_categories/operation/Delete a Spend Category)Delete a Spend Category

Deletes a Spend Category. You need to supply the unique Spend Category identifier that was returned upon Spend Category creation.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Spend Category identifier.

### Responses

**204**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

delete/spend\_categories/{id}

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend\_categories/v1/spend\_categories/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend\_categories/v1/spend\_categories/{id}

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     \-X DELETE \\
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/spend\_categories/v1/spend\_categories/1"

## [](#tag/spend_categories/operation/Update a Spend Category by External ID)Update a Spend Category by External ID

Updates the details of an existing Spend Category. You need to supply the unique external identifier assigned to the Spend Category on creation.

Please note, that request body must include an `id` attribute with the value of your Spend Category unique identifier (the same one you passed in the URL).

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

external\_id

required

string

Example: SP

Unique Spend Category external identifier.

data

object (SpendCategoryUpdate)

**401**

Unauthorized

# Workday Strategic Sourcing Supplier API (1.0)

Download OpenAPI specification:[Download](blob:https://apidocs.workdayspend.com/e34e3f8b-6b14-43a7-9829-bb167a5330a4)

## [](#tag/support)Customer Support

We've provided detailed documentation below to guide you. However, if you need additional assistance, here's how you can get the support you need:

-   **Community Discussions:** Join the conversation on our Workday Community Discussion Boards (found under the "Collaborate" section in community). Connect with other users, share best practices, and get answers to your configuration questions.
-   **Expert Configuration Assistance (Professional Services):** For tailored, hands-on support with your specific project, our Professional Services team is available.
    -   Looking for personalized guidance? Workday Success Plan customers can submit an "Ask" for expert insights on configuration and best practices.
    -   Need custom solutions? Consider Expert Assist, our consulting service for detailed changes and project support.
-   **Reporting System Issues:** If you suspect a problem with the Workday system itself, please connect with our dedicated support team. Your company's Named Support Contact (NSC) can log a Product Support Defect case. We'll review the issue based on its impact and Workday's service level agreement (SLA).

## [](#tag/servers)Servers

### US Region

Environment

US region Base URI

**Production**

[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1)

**Sandbox**

[https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1](https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1)

### EU Region

Environment

EU region Base URI

**Production**

[https://api.eu.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1](https://api.eu.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1)

**Sandbox**

[https://api.sandbox.eu.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1](https://api.sandbox.eu.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1)

### CA Region

Environment

CA region Base URI

**Production**

[https://api.ca.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1](https://api.ca.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1)

**Sandbox**

[https://api.sandbox.ca.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1](https://api.sandbox.ca.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1)

## [](#tag/api_specification)API Specification

The API conforms to the [JSON API Specification](https://jsonapi.org).

The current version of this service is indicated by the `X-Api-Version` header.

Sample version header: `X-Api-Version: 1.0`.

## [](#tag/date_and_time_fields)Date and Time Fields

Our API adheres to the ISO 8601 standard when accepting and formatting Date and Time fields. All Date and Time fields returned by this API will be in the **UTC** timezone.

Date and Time fields sent to this API can be in any timezone, provided they adhere to the ISO 8601 standard.

## [](#tag/authentication)Authentication

The Workday Strategic Sourcing API uses API keys to authenticate requests. Every request will require all 3 HTTP headers:

HTTP Header

Description

**X-Api-Key**

a company-wide API key

**X-User-Token**

a user-specific API token

**X-User-Email**

user email

You can generate all of those from the _API tokens_ section of your _Profile_ page.

Your API keys carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secure! Do not share your secret API keys in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, and so forth.

All API requests must be made over [HTTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Secure). Calls made over plain HTTP will fail. API requests without authentication will also fail.

## [](#tag/rate_limiting)Rate Limiting

Rate limit windows are per second and are shared by all API Keys for a company.

The rate limit is 5 requests per second.

When request submissions exceed the limits, the limit-exceeding requests return `429 Too Many Requests` error responses to the client.

Upon receiving a `429` response, it is recommended to retry the request in compliance with the rate limit. One example would be to add a sleep function for 1 second and retry.

## [](#tag/external_ids)External Identifiers (IDs)

The `external_id` field exists on many of the Workday Strategic Sourcing resources. This optional and mutable extension is intended to store foreign keys of the corresponding resource from a third party system. **These IDs are not considered Sourcing Data and may be logged in external systems. Do not include any sensitive or personal data in IDs.**

The purpose of external IDs is to:

-   Prevent duplicate record creation
-   Allow resources in Workday Strategic Sourcing and a third party system to share the same identifier
-   Allow for records to be queried or updated without requiring knowledge of the Workday Strategic Sourcing generated IDs

## [](#tag/pagination)Pagination

Paginated endpoints may return a subset of the total results for a `GET` request that returns multiple resources. Endpoints that support pagination will include usage details in the Query Parameters section for the resource.

The paginated results can be configured using the `page` query parameter to configure the number of returned results. The default pagination size is 10 results and the maximum pagination size is 100 results per request.

Endpoints that support pagination may return "self" and "next" sections within the "links" section that navigate to the current and next pages respectively.

### Example Paginated Request

#### Request Query Parameter Format

```
/projects?page[size]=25
```

#### Response Schema

The paginated response will also include the following schema

meta

object

Result set metadata.

links

object (PaginationLinks)

List of related links.

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "key": "value"                   },      -   "meta": {          -   "count": 2                   },      -   "links": {          -   "self": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/projects](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/projects)",              -   "next": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/projects?page[cursor]=WzFd&page[direction]=next&page[size]=25](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/projects?page%5Bcursor%5D=WzFd&page%5Bdirection%5D=next&page%5Bsize%5D=25)",              -   "prev": null                   }       }`

## [](#tag/filters)Filters

The results can be filtered to a subset of the total set of results using `filter` query parameters.

Endpoints that support filtering will include usage details in the Query Parameters section for the resource.

Most filters that end in `equals` support a Query Parameter array format to filter by multiple values.

Example:

```
?filter[status_equals][]=submitted&filter[status_equals][]=resubmitted
```

## [](#tag/supplier_companies)Supplier Companies

Use the supplier companies API to create, update, and query the suppliers in Workday Strategic Sourcing.

## [](#tag/supplier_companies/Supplier-Company-Object)Supplier Company Object

type

required

string (SupplierCompanyType)

Object type, should always be `supplier_companies`.

id

required

integer (SupplierCompanyId)

Supplier company identifier string.

attributes

object (SupplierCompanyAttributes)

Supplier company attributes.

relationships

object (SupplierCompanyRelationship)

Supplier company relationships.

links

object (ResourceLinks)

List of related links.

## [](#tag/supplier_companies/operation/List Supplier Companies)List Supplier Companies

Returns a list of supplier companies for the specified criteria.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### query Parameters

filter

object (SupplierCompanyInputFilter)

Filter supplier companies by multiple criteria. Only one filter per attribute is supported. For best performance, we recommend 5 or less filters.

include

string (SupplierCompanyRelatedResources)

Enum: "attachments" "supplier\_category" "supplier\_groups" "default\_payment\_term" "payment\_types" "default\_payment\_type" "payment\_currencies" "default\_payment\_currency" "supplier\_classification\_values"

To reduce the number of HTTP requests, related resources can be requested along with the requested primary resources. Such responses are called "compound documents". In a compound document, all included resources will be represented as an array of resource objects in a top-level `included` member.

The value of the `include` parameter must be a comma-separated list of relationships from the list of available relationships.

```
/supplier_companies?include=payment_types,default_payment_type
```

In the response, relationships will be represented as normal linkage objects (containing `id` and `type`), and full related resource details will be presented in the `included` section as resource objects (with `attributes`, `links`, and potentially `relationships`).

page

object (PageInput)

Customize pagination results with `size`.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**400**

Bad Request

**401**

Unauthorized

get/supplier\_companies

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies"

-   200

## [](#tag/supplier_companies/operation/Create a Supplier Company)Create a Supplier Company

Create a supplier company with given attributes, relationships, and related complex resources.

When creating a supplier company with relationships, keep in mind that there are two kinds of relationships: linked resources and composite resources.

## Linked Resources

These are normal relationship resources managed outside of primary resource (supplier company). For example, payment currencies exist on their own, and can be assigned to one or many supplier companies, contracts, etc. These resources usually have their own API management endpoints.

All related objects should exist prior to being linked to the supplier company. They can be referenced by Workday Strategic Sourcing identifier, or by external ID; in the latter case, the relationship name is used with prefix `external_`. For example, a payment currency with Workday Strategic Sourcing ID `"1"` and external ID `"C$EUR"` can be used to initialize `default_payment_currency`:

```json
{
  "default_payment_currency": {
    "data" {
      "id": "1",
      "type": "payment_currencies"
    }
  }
}
```

```json
{
  "external_default_payment_currency": {
    "data" {
      "id": "C$EUR",
      "type": "payment_currencies"
    }
  }
}
```

When `external_` prefix is applied to a "many" relationship, like `external_payment_currencies`, all of the identifiers will be treated as external IDs.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierCompanyRelatedResources)

Enum: "attachments" "supplier\_category" "supplier\_groups" "default\_payment\_term" "payment\_types" "default\_payment\_type" "payment\_currencies" "default\_payment\_currency" "supplier\_classification\_values"

Use the `include` parameter to request related resources along with the primary resource. (see "List Supplier Companies" for more details).

##### Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json

data

object (SupplierCompanyCreate)

### Responses

**201**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

post/supplier\_companies

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies

### Request samples

-   Payload
-   Curl

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "type": "supplier_companies",              -   "attributes": {                  -   "name": "Supplier Company Name",                      -   "description": "Suppler Company Description",                      -   {                                  -   "name": "Custom Field URL",                                      -   "value": "[http://www.example.com](http://www.example.com)"                                                       }                                           ]                               },              -   "relationships": {                  -   "default_payment_currency": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "id": "172",                                      -   "type": "payment_currencies"                                                       }                                           },                      -   "default_payment_term": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "id": "38",                                      -   "type": "payment_terms"                                                       }                                           },                      -   "default_payment_type": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "id": "99",                                      -   "type": "payment_types"                                                       }                                           },                      -   "supplier_category": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "id": "83",                                      -   "type": "supplier_categories"                                                       }                                           },                      -   "payment_currencies": {                          -   "data": [                                  -   {                                          -   "id": "172",                                              -   "type": "payment_currencies"                                                                   }                                                       ]                                           },                      -   "payment_types": {                          -   "data": [                                  -   {                                          -   "id": "99",                                              -   "type": "payment_types"                                                                   }                                                       ]                                           },                      -   "supplier_groups": {                          -   "data": [                                  -   {                                          -   "id": "48",                                              -   "type": "supplier_groups"                                                                   }                                                       ]                                           },                      -   "supplier_classification_values": {                          -   "data": [                                  -   {                                          -   "id": "21"                                                                   }                                                       ]                                           }                               }                   }       }`

## [](#tag/supplier_companies/operation/Get a Supplier Company)Get a Supplier Company

Retrieves the details of an existing supplier company. You need to supply the unique supplier company identifier that was returned upon supplier company creation.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Supplier Company identifier.

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierCompanyRelatedResources)

Enum: "attachments" "supplier\_category" "supplier\_groups" "default\_payment\_term" "payment\_types" "default\_payment\_type" "payment\_currencies" "default\_payment\_currency" "supplier\_classification\_values"

Use the `include` parameter to request related resources along with the primary resource. (see "List Supplier Companies" for more details).

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies/{id}

-   Curl

## [](#tag/supplier_companies/operation/Update a Supplier Company)Update a Supplier Company

Updates the details of an existing supplier company. You need to supply the unique supplier company identifier that was returned upon supplier company creation.

Please note, that request body must include an `id` attribute with the value of your supplier unique identifier (the same one you passed in the URL).

## Linked Resources

When updating relationships on a supplier company resource, keep in mind the whole relationship will be replaced the new values. For example, if a supplier company has currencies with IDs `"1"` and `"2"`, and in update request payload `payment_currencies` relationship is specified with ID `"3"`, the only payment currency associated after the request succeeded will be `"3"`.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Supplier Company identifier.

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierCompanyRelatedResources)

Enum: "attachments" "supplier\_category" "supplier\_groups" "default\_payment\_term" "payment\_types" "default\_payment\_type" "payment\_currencies" "default\_payment\_currency" "supplier\_classification\_values"

Use the `include` parameter to request related resources along with the primary resource. (see "List Supplier Companies" for more details).

##### Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json

data

object (SupplierCompanyUpdate)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

**409**

Conflict

patch/supplier\_companies/{id}

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies/{id}

-   Payload
-   Curl

## [](#tag/supplier_companies/operation/Get a Supplier Company by External ID)Get a Supplier Company by External ID

Retrieves the details of an existing supplier company. You need to supply the unique supplier company external identifier (the one you used when created the supplier company).

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

external\_id

required

string

Example: 1234-5678-abcd-efgh

Supplier company external identifier.

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierCompanyRelatedResources)

Enum: "attachments" "supplier\_category" "supplier\_groups" "default\_payment\_term" "payment\_types" "default\_payment\_type" "payment\_currencies" "default\_payment\_currency" "supplier\_classification\_values"

Use the `include` parameter to request related resources along with the primary resource. (see "List Supplier Companies" for more details).

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

  {                                  -   "name": "Custom Field URL",                                      -   "value": "[http://www.example.com](http://www.example.com)"                                                       }                                           ]                               },              -   "relationships": {                  -   "attachments": {                          -   "data": [ ]                                           },                      -   "default_payment_currency": {                          -   "data": null                                           },                      -   "default_payment_term": {                          -   "data": null                                           },                      -   "default_payment_type": {                          -   "data": null                                           },                      -   "supplier_category": {                          -   "data": null                                           },                      -   "payment_currencies": {                          -   "data": [ ]                                           },                      -   "payment_types": {                          -   "data": [ ]                                           },                      -   "supplier_groups": {                          -   "data": [ ]                                           },                      -   "supplier_classification_values": {                          -   "data": [ ]                                           }                               },              -   "links": {                  -   "self": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier_companies/1](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier_companies/1)"                               }                   }       }`

## [](#tag/supplier_companies/operation/Update a Supplier Company by External ID)Update a Supplier Company by External ID

Updates the details of an existing supplier company. You need to supply the unique supplier company external identifier (the one you used when created the supplier company).

Please note, that request body must include an `id` attribute with the value of your supplier external identifier (the same one you passed in the URL).

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

external\_id

required

string

Example: 1234-5678-abcd-efgh

Supplier company external identifier.

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierCompanyRelatedResources)

Enum: "attachments" "supplier\_category" "supplier\_groups" "default\_payment\_term" "payment\_types" "default\_payment\_type" "payment\_currencies" "default\_payment\_currency" "supplier\_classification\_values"

Use the `include` parameter to request related resources along with the primary resource. (see "List Supplier Companies" for more details).

##### Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json

data

object (SupplierCompanyUpdate)

## [](#tag/supplier_contacts)Supplier Contacts

required

Object type, should always be `supplier_contacts`.

required

integer (SupplierContactId)

object (SupplierContactAttributes)

object (SupplierContactRelationshipCreate)

Supplier contact relationships.

links

object (ResourceLinks)

List of related links.

`{  -   "type": "supplier_contacts",      -   "id": "1",      -   "attributes": {          -   "name": "Supplier Contact Name #1",              -   "first_name": null,              -   "last_name": null,              -   "email": "supplier.contact1@example.com",              -   "notes": "Supplier Contact Notes",              -   "phone_number": "555-555-5555",              -   "job_title": "Supplier Contact Job Title",              -   "is_suggested": false,              -   "external_id": "CNT-17",              -   "updated_at": "2019-10-29T21:28:46.790Z"                   },      -   "relationships": {          -   "supplier_company": {                  -   "data": {                          -   "id": "1",                              -   "type": "supplier_companies"                                           }                               },              -   "contact_types": {                  -   "data": [                          -   {                                  -   "id": "1",                                      -   "type": "contact_types"                                                       }                                           ]                               },              -   "phones": {                  -   "data": [                          -   {                                  -   "id": "1",                                      -   "type": "phones"                                                       }                                           ]                               }                   },      -   "links": {          -   "self": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier_contacts/1](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier_contacts/1)"                   }       }`

## [](#tag/supplier_contacts/operation/List Supplier Contacts)List Supplier Contacts

Retrieves the list of contacts for an existing supplier company.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

company\_id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique supplier company identifier.

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierContactRelatedResources)

Enum: "supplier\_company" "contact\_types" "phones"

To reduce the number of HTTP requests, related resources can be requested along with the requested primary resources. Such responses are called "compound documents". In a compound document, all included resources will be represented as an array of resource objects in a top-level `included` member.

The value of the `include` parameter must be a comma-separated list of relationships from the list of available relationships.

```
/supplier_contacts?include=supplier_company
```

In the response, relationships will be represented as normal linkage objects (containing `id` and `type`), and related resource details will be presented in the `included` section as resource objects (with `attributes` that have a corresponding `external_id`).

filter

object (SupplierContactInputFilter)

Filter supplier contacts by multiple criteria. Only one filter per attribute is supported. For best performance, we recommend 5 or less filters.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/supplier\_companies/{company\_id}/supplier\_contacts

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies/{company\_id}/supplier\_contacts

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies/{company\_id}/supplier\_contacts

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies/1/supplier\_contacts"

### Response samples

## [](#tag/supplier_contacts/operation/Create a Supplier Contact)Create a Supplier Contact

Create a supplier contact with given attributes.

## Linked Resources

The supplier company should exist prior to being linked to the supplier contact. It can be referenced by Workday Strategic Sourcing identifier, or by external ID; in the latter case, the relationship name is used with prefix `external_`. For example, a supplier company with Workday Strategic Sourcing ID `"1"` and external ID `"SCM-1"` can be used to initialize `supplier_company`:

```json
{
  "supplier_company": {
    "data" {
      "id": "1",
      "type": "supplier_companies"
    }
  }
}
```

```json
{
  "external_supplier_company": {
    "data" {
      "id": "SCM-1",
      "type": "supplier_companies"
    }
  }
}
```

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierContactRelatedResources)

Enum: "supplier\_company" "contact\_types" "phones"

Use the `include` parameter to request a primary resource `supplier company`.

##### Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json

data

object (SupplierContactCreate)

### Responses

**201**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

post/supplier\_contacts

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_contacts

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_contacts

### Request samples

-   Payload
-   Curl

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Example

with\_supplier\_companywith\_external\_supplier\_companywith\_supplier\_company

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "type": "supplier_contacts",              -   "attributes": {                  -   "name": "Supplier Contact Name",                      -   "email": "supplier.contact1@example.com",                      -   "notes": "Supplier Contact Notes",                      -   "phone_number": "555-555-5555",                      -   "job_title": "Supplier Contact Job Title",                      -   "is_suggested": false,                      -   "external_id": "CNT-17"                               },              -   "relationships": {                  -   "supplier_company": {                          -   "data": {                                  -   "id": "1",                                      -   "type": "supplier_companies"                                                       }                                           },                      -   "contact_types": {                          -   "data": [                                  -   {                                          -   "id": 1,                                              -   "type": "contact_types"                                                                   }                                                       ]                                           }                               }                   }       }`

### Response samples

-   201

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Example

default responsecompound responsedefault response

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

  "links": {                  -   "self": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier_contacts/1](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier_contacts/1)"                               }                   }       }`

## [](#tag/supplier_contacts/operation/Get a Supplier Contact)Get a Supplier Contact

Retrieves the details of an existing supplier contact.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

## [](#tag/supplier_contacts/operation/List Supplier Contacts by Supplier Company External ID)List Supplier Contacts by Supplier Company External ID

Retrieves the list of contacts for an existing supplier company by Supplier Company External ID.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

external\_id

required

string

Example: 1234-5678-abcd-efgh

Supplier company external identifier.

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierContactRelatedResources)

Enum: "supplier\_company" "contact\_types" "phones"

To reduce the number of HTTP requests, related resources can be requested along with the requested primary resources. Such responses are called "compound documents". In a compound document, all included resources will be represented as an array of resource objects in a top-level `included` member.

The value of the `include` parameter must be a comma-separated list of relationships from the list of available relationships.

```
/supplier_contacts?include=supplier_company
```

In the response, relationships will be represented as normal linkage objects (containing `id` and `type`), and related resource details will be presented in the `included` section as resource objects (with `attributes` that have a corresponding `external_id`).

filter

object (SupplierContactInputFilter)

Filter supplier contacts by multiple criteria. Only one filter per attribute is supported. For best performance, we recommend 5 or less filters.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/supplier\_companies/{external\_id}/supplier\_contacts/external\_id

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies/{external\_id}/supplier\_contacts/external\_id

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies/{external\_id}/supplier\_contacts/external\_id

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_companies/1234-5678-abcd-efgh/supplier\_contacts/external\_id"

## [](#tag/supplier_classifications)Supplier Classifications

## [](#tag/supplier_classifications/Supplier-Classification-Object)Supplier Classification Object

type

required

string (SupplierClassificationType)

Object type, should always be `supplier_classifications`.

id

required

integer (SupplierClassificationId)

Supplier classification identifier string.

attributes

object (SupplierClassificationAttributes)

SupplierClassification attributes.

relationships

object (SupplierClassificationRelationship)

Supplier classification relationships.

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "id": "1",              -   "type": "supplier_classifications",              -   "attributes": {                  -   "name": "Veteran Business",                      -   "active": true,                      -   "order": 1,                      -   "country_alpha2": "US",                      -   "external_id": "SC-EXT-ID-1",                      -   "request_additional_information": true,                      -   "codename": "diversity"                               }                   }       }`

## [](#tag/supplier_classifications/operation/List Supplier Classifications)List Supplier Classifications

Returns a list of supplier classifications.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierClassificationRelatedResources)

Value: "supplier\_classification\_fields"

To reduce the number of HTTP requests, related resources can be requested along with the requested primary resources. Such responses are called "compound documents". In a compound document, all included resources will be represented as an array of resource objects in a top-level `included` member.

The value of the `include` parameter must be a comma-separated list of relationships from the list of available relationships.

```
/supplier_classifications?include=supplier_classification_fields
```

In the response, relationships will be represented as normal linkage objects (containing `id` and `type`), and related resource details will be presented in the `included` section as resource objects (with `attributes` that have a corresponding `external_id`).

filter

object (SupplierClassificationInputFilter)

Filter supplier classifications by codename.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

## [](#tag/supplier_classifications/operation/Create a Supplier Classification)Create a Supplier Classification

Create a supplier classifications with given attributes, relationships, and related complex resources.

```json
{
  "data": {
    "type": "supplier_classifications",
    "attributes": {
      "name": "Classification 1",
      "order": 1,
      "country_alpha2": "CA",
      "codename": "diversity",
      "active": true,
      "external_id": "CLASSIFICATION-1",
      "request_additional_information": false
    }
  }
}
```

## Composite Resources

Resources that do not exist outside of parent resource, and are managed within the scope of parent resource, cannot be pre-created in advance. Supplier classifications have one composite resource `supplier_classification_fields` that includes another composite resource in itself - `supplier_classification_field_options`.

In order to create these resource along with the parent object, compound document must be used:

```json
{
  "data": {
    "type": "supplier_classifications",
    "attributes": {
      "name": "Classification 1",
      "order": 1,
      "country_alpha2": "CA",
      "codename": "diversity",
      "active": true,
      "external_id": "CLASSIFICATION-1",
      "request_additional_information": true
    },
    "relationships": {
      "supplier_classification_fields": {
        "data": [
          {
            "id": "CLASSIFICATION-FIELD-1",
            "type": "supplier_classification_fields"
          },
        ]
      }
    },
    "included": [
      {
        "id": "CLASSIFICATION-FIELD-1",
        "type": "supplier_classification_fields",
        "attributes": {
          "name": "Field 1",
          "order": 1,
          "required": false,
          "kind": "SELECT",
          "external_id": "CLASSIFICATION-FIELD-1"
        },
        "relationships": {
          "supplier_classification_field_options": {
            "data": [
              {
                "id": "CLASSIFICATION-FIELD-OPTION-1",
                "type": "supplier_classification_field_options"
              },
              {
                "id": "CLASSIFICATION-FIELD-OPTION-2",
                "type": "supplier_classification_field_options"
              }
            ]
          }
        }
      },
      {
        "id": "CLASSIFICATION-FIELD-OPTION-1",
        "type": "supplier_classification_field_options",
        "attributes": {
          "label": "Option 1",
          "order": 1,
          "external_id": "CLASSIFICATION-FIELD-OPTION-1"
        }
      },
      {
        "id": "CLASSIFICATION-FIELD-OPTION-2",
        "type": "supplier_classification_field_options",
        "attributes": {
          "label": "Option 2",
          "order": 2,
          "external_id": "CLASSIFICATION-FIELD-OPTION-2"
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierClassificationRelatedResources)

Value: "supplier\_classification\_fields"

Use the `include` parameter to request related resources along with the primary resource.

##### Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json

data

object (SupplierClassification)

included

Array of SupplierClassificationField (object) or SupplierClassificationFieldOption (object) (SupplierClassificationIncludedMutationResources)

### Responses

**201**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

post/supplier\_classifications

Production Server

https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_classifications

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_classifications

### Request samples

-   Payload
-   Curl

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Example

simple requestcompound documentsimple request

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "type": "supplier_classifications",              -   "attributes": {                  -   "name": "SBE - Small Business Enterprise",                      -   "order": 1,                      -   "country_alpha2": "CA",                      -   "external_id": "SC-1",                      -   "codename": "diversity",                      -   "active": true,                      -   "request_additional_information": false                               }                   }       }`

### Response samples

-   201

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Example

default\_responsecompound\_responsepreview\_responsedefault\_response

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "id": "1",              -   "type": "supplier_classifications",              -   "attributes": {                  -   "name": "SBE - Small Business Enterprise",                      -   "order": 1,                      -   "country_alpha2": "CA",                      -   "external_id": "SC-1",                      -   "codename": "diversity",                      -   "active": true,                      -   "request_additional_information": false                               },              -   "relationships": {                  -   "supplier_classification_fields": {                          -   "data": [ ]                                           }                               },              -   "links": {                  -   "self": "[https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier_classifications/1](https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier_classifications/1)"                               }                   }       }`

## [](#tag/supplier_company_risks)Supplier Company Risks

Use the supplier company risks API to create, update, and query the supplier company risks in Workday Strategic Sourcing.

## [](#tag/supplier_company_risks/Supplier-Company-Risk-Object)Supplier Company Risk Object

type

required

string (SupplierCompanyRiskType)

Object type, should always be `supplier_company_risks`.

id

required

integer (SupplierCompanyRiskId)

Supplier company risk identifier string.

     "https://api.us.workdayspend.com/services/suppliers/v1/supplier\_categories/SUPCAT/external\_id"

## [](#tag/supplier_groups)Supplier Groups

Use the supplier groups API to create, update, and query the supplier groups in Workday Strategic Sourcing.

type

required

string (SupplierGroupType)

Object type, should always be `supplier_groups`.

id

required

integer (SupplierGroupId)

attributes

object (SupplierGroupAttributes)

Supplier group attributes.

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "type": "supplier_groups",      -   "id": 1,      -   "attributes": {          -   "name": "string",              -   "external_id": "string"                   }       }`

        -   postCreate a Payment Type
        -   patchUpdate a Payment Type
        -   delDelete a Payment Type
        -   patchUpdate a Payment Type by External ID
        -   delDelete a Payment Type by External ID
    -   Supplier Company Segmentations
        -   Supplier Company Segmentation Object
        -   getList Supplier Company Segmentations
        -   postCreate a Supplier Company Segmentation
        -   patchUpdate a Supplier Company Segmentation
        -   delDelete a Supplier Company Segmentation
    -   Supplier Company Segmentation Statuses
        -   Supplier Company Segmentation Status Object
        -   getList Supplier Company Segmentation Statuses
        -   postCreate a Supplier Company Segmentation Status
        -   patchUpdate a Supplier Company Segmentation Status
        -   delDelete a Supplier Company Segmentation Status
    -   Supplier Company Risks
        -   Supplier Company Risk Object
        -   getList Supplier Company Risks
        -   postCreate a Supplier Company Risk
        -   patchUpdate a Supplier Company Risk
        -   delDelete a Supplier Company risk
    -   Supplier Categories
        -   Supplier Category Object
        -   getList Supplier Categories
        -   postCreate a Supplier Category
        -   patchUpdate a Supplier Category
        -   delDelete a Supplier Category
        -   patchUpdate a Supplier Category by External ID
        -   delDelete a Supplier Category by External ID
    -   Supplier Groups
        -   Supplier Group Object
        -   getList Supplier Groups
        -   postCreate a Supplier Group
        -   patchUpdate a Supplier Group
        -   delDelete a Supplier Group
        -   patchUpdate a Supplier Group by External ID
        -   delDelete a Supplier Group by External ID
    -   Payment Currencies
        -   Payment Currency Object
        -   getList Payment Currencies
        -   postCreate a Payment Currency
        -   patchUpdate a Payment Currency
        -   delDelete a Payment Currency
        -   patchUpdate a Payment Currency by External ID
        -   delDelete a Payment Currency by External ID
-   Awards
    -   Awards
        -   Award Object
        -   getList Awards
    -   Award Line Items
        -   Award Line Item Object
        -   getList Award Line Items
        -   getGet an Award Line Item
-   Attachments
    -   Attachments
        -   Working with Attachments
        -   Attachment Object
        -   getList Attachments
        -   postCreate an Attachment
        -   getGet an Attachment
        -   patchUpdate an Attachment
        -   getGet an Attachment by External ID

-   Spend Categories

-   Users

# Workday Strategic Sourcing API (Deprecated) (3.0)

Download OpenAPI specification:[Download](blob:https://apidocs.workdayspend.com/856b2fc7-4858-40f0-a4a5-50857e414842)

## [](#tag/support)Customer Support

We've provided detailed documentation below to guide you. However, if you need additional assistance, here's how you can get the support you need:

-   **Community Discussions:** Join the conversation on our Workday Community Discussion Boards (found under the "Collaborate" section in community). Connect with other users, share best practices, and get answers to your configuration questions.
-   **Expert Configuration Assistance (Professional Services):** For tailored, hands-on support with your specific project, our Professional Services team is available.
    -   Looking for personalized guidance? Workday Success Plan customers can submit an "Ask" for expert insights on configuration and best practices.
    -   Need custom solutions? Consider Expert Assist, our consulting service for detailed changes and project support.
-   **Reporting System Issues:** If you suspect a problem with the Workday system itself, please connect with our dedicated support team. Your company's Named Support Contact (NSC) can log a Product Support Defect case. We'll review the issue based on its impact and Workday's service level agreement (SLA).

## [](#tag/api_specification)API Specification

The API conforms to the [JSON API Specification](https://jsonapi.org).

## [](#tag/date_and_time_fields)Date and Time Fields

Our API adheres to the ISO 8601 standard when accepting and formatting Date and Time fields. All Date and Time fields returned by this API will be in the **UTC** timezone.

Date and Time fields sent to this API can be in any timezone, provided they adhere to the ISO 8601 standard.

## [](#tag/authentication)Authentication

The Workday Strategic Sourcing API uses API keys to authenticate requests. Every request will require all 3 HTTP headers:

HTTP Header

Description

**X-Api-Key**

a company-wide API key

**X-User-Token**

a user-specific API token

**X-User-Email**

user email

You can generate all of those from the _API tokens_ section of your _Profile_ page.

Your API keys carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secure! Do not share your secret API keys in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, and so forth.

All API requests must be made over [HTTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Secure). Calls made over plain HTTP will fail. API requests without authentication will also fail.

## [](#tag/rate_limiting)Rate Limiting

Rate limit windows are per second and are shared by all API Keys for a company.

The rate limit is 5 requests per second.

When request submissions exceed the limits, the limit-exceeding requests return `429 Too Many Requests` error responses to the client.

Upon receiving a `429` response, it is recommended to retry the request in compliance with the rate limit. One example would be to add a sleep function for 1 second and retry.

## [](#tag/external_ids)External Identifiers (IDs)

The `external_id` field exists on many of the Workday Strategic Sourcing resources. This optional and mutable extension is intended to store foreign keys of the corresponding resource from a third party system. **These IDs are not considered Sourcing Data and may be logged in external systems. Do not include any sensitive or personal data in IDs.**

The purpose of external IDs is to:

-   Prevent duplicate record creation
-   Allow resources in Workday Strategic Sourcing and a third party system to share the same identifier
-   Allow for records to be queried or updated without requiring knowledge of the Workday Strategic Sourcing generated IDs

## [](#tag/pagination)Pagination

Paginated endpoints may return a subset of the total results for a `GET` request that returns multiple resources. Endpoints that support pagination will include usage details in the Query Parameters section for the resource.

The paginated results can be configured using the `page` query parameter to configure the number of returned results. The default pagination size is 10 results and the maximum pagination size is 100 results per request.

Endpoints that support pagination may return "self" and "next" sections within the "links" section that navigate to the current and next pages respectively.

### Example Paginated Request

#### Request Query Parameter Format

```
/projects?page[size]=25
```

#### Response Schema

The paginated response will also include the following schema

meta

object

Result set metadata.

links

object (PaginationLinks)

List of related links.

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "key": "value"                   },      -   "meta": {          -   "count": 2                   },      -   "links": {          -   "self": "[https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/projects](https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/projects)",              -   "next": "[https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/projects?page[cursor]=WzFd&page[direction]=next&page[size]=25](https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/projects?page%5Bcursor%5D=WzFd&page%5Bdirection%5D=next&page%5Bsize%5D=25)",              -   "prev": null                   }       }`

## [](#tag/filters)Filters

The results can be filtered to a subset of the total set of results using `filter` query parameters.

Endpoints that support filtering will include usage details in the Query Parameters section for the resource.

Most filters that end in `equals` support a Query Parameter array format to filter by multiple values.

Example:

```
?filter[status_equals][]=submitted&filter[status_equals][]=resubmitted
```

## [](#tag/supplier_companies)Supplier Companies

Use the supplier companies API to create, update, and query the suppliers in Workday Strategic Sourcing.

## [](#tag/supplier_companies/Supplier-Company-Object)Supplier Company Object

type

required

string (SupplierCompanyType)

Object type, should always be `supplier_companies`.

id

required

integer (SupplierCompanyId)

Supplier company identifier string.

attributes

object (SupplierCompanyAttributes)

Supplier company attributes.

relationships

object (SupplierCompanyRelationship)

Supplier company relationships.

links

object (ResourceLinks)

List of related links.

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "type": "supplier_companies",      -   "id": "1",      -   "attributes": {          -   "name": "Supplier Company Name",              -   "description": "Suppler Company Description",              - required

string (SupplierClassificationValueId)

A composite identifier for a virtual object created from the id of the supplier and the id of the classification in the response. Id or the external Id of a classification in the request.

attributes

relationships

object (SupplierClassificationValueRelationship)

Supplier classification value relationships.

## [](#tag/supplier_companies/operation/List Supplier Companies)List Supplier Companies

Returns a list of supplier companies for the specified criteria.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### query Parameters

segmentation\_status

string (SupplierSegmentationStatus)

Deprecated

Enum: "not\_approved" "reviewing" "approved" "out\_of\_compliance" "blacklisted"

Filter suppliers by segmentation status.

filter

object (SupplierCompanyInputFilter)

Filter supplier companies by multiple criteria. Only one filter per attribute is supported. For best performance, we recommend 5 or less filters.

include

string (SupplierCompanyRelatedResources)

Enum: "attachments" "supplier\_category" "supplier\_groups" "default\_payment\_term" "payment\_types" "default\_payment\_type" "payment\_currencies" "default\_payment\_currency" "supplier\_classification\_values"

To reduce the number of HTTP requests, related resources can be requested along with the requested primary resources. Such responses are called "compound documents". In a compound document, all included resources will be represented as an array of resource objects in a top-level `included` member.

The value of the `include` parameter must be a comma-separated list of relationships from the list of available relationships.

```
/supplier_companies?include=payment_types,default_payment_type
```

In the response, relationships will be represented as normal linkage objects (containing `id` and `type`), and full related resource details will be presented in the `included` section as resource objects (with `attributes`, `links`, and potentially `relationships`).

page

object (PageInput)

Customize pagination results with `size`.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**400**

Bad Request

**401**

Unauthorized

get/supplier\_companies

Production Server

https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     "https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies?segmentation\_status=approved"

### Response samples

-   200
-   400

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Example

default responsecompound documentdefault response

  "prev": "[https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier_companies?page[cursor]=WyJzdXBwbGllciBjb21wYW55IDAwIiwxMDVd&page[direction]=prev&page[size]=10](https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier_companies?page%5Bcursor%5D=WyJzdXBwbGllciBjb21wYW55IDAwIiwxMDVd&page%5Bdirection%5D=prev&page%5Bsize%5D=10)"                   }       }`

## [](#tag/supplier_companies/operation/Create a Supplier Company)Create a Supplier Company

Create a supplier company with given attributes, relationships, and related complex resources.

When creating a supplier company with relationships, keep in mind that there are two kinds of relationships: linked resources and composite resources.

## Linked Resources

These are normal relationship resources managed outside of primary resource (supplier company). For example, payment currencies exist on their own, and can be assigned to one or many supplier companies, contracts, etc. These resources usually have their own API management endpoints.

All related objects should exist prior to being linked to the supplier company. They can be referenced by Workday Strategic Sourcing identifier, or by external ID; in the latter case, the relationship name is used with prefix `external_`. For example, a payment currency with Workday Strategic Sourcing ID `"1"` and external ID `"C$EUR"` can be used to initialize `default_payment_currency`:

```json
{
  "default_payment_currency": {
    "data" {
      "id": "1",
      "type": "payment_currencies"
    }
  }
}
```

```json
{
  "external_default_payment_currency": {
    "data" {
      "id": "C$EUR",
      "type": "payment_currencies"
    }
  }
}
```

When `external_` prefix is applied to a "many" relationship, like `external_payment_currencies`, all of the identifiers will be treated as external IDs.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierCompanyRelatedResources)

Enum: "attachments" "supplier\_category" "supplier\_groups" "default\_payment\_term" "payment\_types" "default\_payment\_type" "payment\_currencies" "default\_payment\_currency" "supplier\_classification\_values"

Use the `include` parameter to request related resources along with the primary resource. (see "List Supplier Companies" for more details).

##### Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json

data

object (SupplierCompanyCreate)

### Responses

**201**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

post/supplier\_companies

Production Server

https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies

## [](#tag/supplier_companies/operation/Get a Supplier Company)Get a Supplier Company

Retrieves the details of an existing supplier company. You need to supply the unique supplier company identifier that was returned upon supplier company creation.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Supplier Company identifier.

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierCompanyRelatedResources)

Enum: "attachments" "supplier\_category" "supplier\_groups" "default\_payment\_term" "payment\_types" "default\_payment\_type" "payment\_currencies" "default\_payment\_currency" "supplier\_classification\_values"

Use the `include` parameter to request related resources along with the primary resource. (see "List Supplier Companies" for more details).

## [](#tag/supplier_companies/operation/Update a Supplier Company)Update a Supplier Company

Updates the details of an existing supplier company. You need to supply the unique supplier company identifier that was returned upon supplier company creation.

Please note, that request body must include an `id` attribute with the value of your supplier unique identifier (the same one you passed in the URL).

## Linked Resources

When updating relationships on a supplier company resource, keep in mind the whole relationship will be replaced the new values. For example, if a supplier company has currencies with IDs `"1"` and `"2"`, and in update request payload `payment_currencies` relationship is specified with ID `"3"`, the only payment currency associated after the request succeeded will be `"3"`.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Supplier Company identifier.

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierCompanyRelatedResources)

Enum: "attachments" "supplier\_category" "supplier\_groups" "default\_payment\_term" "payment\_types" "default\_payment\_type" "payment\_currencies" "default\_payment\_currency" "supplier\_classification\_values"

Use the `include` parameter to request related resources along with the primary resource. (see "List Supplier Companies" for more details).

##### Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json

data

object (SupplierCompanyUpdate)

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

**409**

Conflict

patch/supplier\_companies/{id}

Production Server

https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies/{id}

## [](#tag/supplier_companies/operation/Delete a Supplier Company)Delete a Supplier Company

Deletes a supplier company. You need to supply the unique supplier company identifier that was returned upon supplier company creation.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique Supplier Company identifier.

### Responses

**204**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

**404**

Not Found

delete/supplier\_companies/{id}

Production Server

https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies/{id}

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies/{id}

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     \-X DELETE \\
     "https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies/1"

## [](#tag/supplier_contacts)Supplier Contacts

required

Supplier contact relationships.

object (ResourceLinks)

## [](#tag/supplier_contacts/operation/List Supplier Contacts)List Supplier Contacts

Retrieves the list of contacts for an existing supplier company.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

company\_id

required

integer

Example: 1

Unique supplier company identifier.

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierContactRelatedResources)

Enum: "supplier\_company" "contact\_types" "phones"

To reduce the number of HTTP requests, related resources can be requested along with the requested primary resources. Such responses are called "compound documents". In a compound document, all included resources will be represented as an array of resource objects in a top-level `included` member.

The value of the `include` parameter must be a comma-separated list of relationships from the list of available relationships.

```
/supplier_contacts?include=supplier_company
```

In the response, relationships will be represented as normal linkage objects (containing `id` and `type`), and related resource details will be presented in the `included` section as resource objects (with `attributes` that have a corresponding `external_id`).

filter

object (SupplierContactInputFilter)

Filter supplier contacts by multiple criteria. Only one filter per attribute is supported. For best performance, we recommend 5 or less filters.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/supplier\_companies/{company\_id}/supplier\_contacts

Production Server

https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies/{company\_id}/supplier\_contacts

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies/{company\_id}/supplier\_contacts

### Request samples

-   Curl

Copy

curl \-H "X-Api-Key: ${COMPANY\_KEY}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\
     "https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies/1/supplier\_contacts"

### Response samples

-   200

Content type

application/vnd.api+json

Example

default responsecompound responsedefault response

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "meta": {          -   "count": 2                   },      -   "data": [          -   {                  -   "type": "supplier_contacts",                      -   "id": "1",                      -   "links": {          -   "self": "[https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier_companies/1/supplier_contacts](https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier_companies/1/supplier_contacts)"                   }       }`

## [](#tag/supplier_contacts/operation/Create a Supplier Contact)Create a Supplier Contact

Create a supplier contact with given attributes.

## Linked Resources

The supplier company should exist prior to being linked to the supplier contact. It can be referenced by Workday Strategic Sourcing identifier, or by external ID; in the latter case, the relationship name is used with prefix `external_`. For example, a supplier company with Workday Strategic Sourcing ID `"1"` and external ID `"SCM-1"` can be used to initialize `supplier_company`:

```json
{
  "supplier_company": {
    "data" {
      "id": "1",
      "type": "supplier_companies"
    }
  }
}
```

```json
{
  "external_supplier_company": {
    "data" {
      "id": "SCM-1",
      "type": "supplier_companies"
    }
  }
}
```

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierContactRelatedResources)

Enum: "supplier\_company" "contact\_types" "phones"

Use the `include` parameter to request a primary resource `supplier company`.

##### Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json

data

object (SupplierContactCreate)

### Responses

**201**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

## [](#tag/supplier_contacts/operation/List Supplier Contacts by Supplier Company External ID)List Supplier Contacts by Supplier Company External ID

Retrieves the list of contacts for an existing supplier company by Supplier Company External ID.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### path Parameters

external\_id

required

string

Example: 1234-5678-abcd-efgh

Supplier company external identifier.

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierContactRelatedResources)

Enum: "supplier\_company" "contact\_types" "phones"

To reduce the number of HTTP requests, related resources can be requested along with the requested primary resources. Such responses are called "compound documents". In a compound document, all included resources will be represented as an array of resource objects in a top-level `included` member.

The value of the `include` parameter must be a comma-separated list of relationships from the list of available relationships.

```
/supplier_contacts?include=supplier_company
```

In the response, relationships will be represented as normal linkage objects (containing `id` and `type`), and related resource details will be presented in the `included` section as resource objects (with `attributes` that have a corresponding `external_id`).

filter

object (SupplierContactInputFilter)

Filter supplier contacts by multiple criteria. Only one filter per attribute is supported. For best performance, we recommend 5 or less filters.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/supplier\_companies/{external\_id}/supplier\_contacts/external\_id

Production Server

https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies/{external\_id}/supplier\_contacts/external\_id

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_companies/{external\_id}/supplier\_contacts/external\_id

     \-H "X-User-Token: ${USER\_TOKEN}" \\
     \-H "X-User-Email: ${USER\_EMAIL}" \\
     \-H "Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json" \\

## [](#tag/supplier_classifications)Supplier Classifications

## [](#tag/supplier_classifications/Supplier-Classification-Object)Supplier Classification Object

type

required

string (SupplierClassificationType)

Object type, should always be `supplier_classifications`.

id

required

integer (SupplierClassificationId)

Supplier classification identifier string.

attributes

object (SupplierClassificationAttributes)

SupplierClassification attributes.

relationships

object (SupplierClassificationRelationship)

Supplier classification relationships.

Copy

Expand all Collapse all

`{  -   "data": {          -   "id": "1",              -   "type": "supplier_classifications",              -   "attributes": {                  -   "name": "Veteran Business",                      -   "active": true,                      -   "order": 1,                      -   "country_alpha2": "US",                      -   "external_id": "SC-EXT-ID-1",                      -   "request_additional_information": true,                      -   "codename": "diversity"                               }                   }       }`

## [](#tag/supplier_classifications/operation/List Supplier Classifications)List Supplier Classifications

Returns a list of supplier classifications.

##### Authorizations:

(_api\_key__user\_token__user\_email_)

##### query Parameters

include

string (SupplierClassificationRelatedResources)

Value: "supplier\_classification\_fields"

To reduce the number of HTTP requests, related resources can be requested along with the requested primary resources. Such responses are called "compound documents". In a compound document, all included resources will be represented as an array of resource objects in a top-level `included` member.

The value of the `include` parameter must be a comma-separated list of relationships from the list of available relationships.

```
/supplier_classifications?include=supplier_classification_fields
```

In the response, relationships will be represented as normal linkage objects (containing `id` and `type`), and related resource details will be presented in the `included` section as resource objects (with `attributes` that have a corresponding `external_id`).

filter

object (SupplierClassificationInputFilter)

Filter supplier classifications by codename.

### Responses

**200**

OK

**401**

Unauthorized

get/supplier\_classifications

Production Server

https://api.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_classifications

Sandbox Server

https://api.sandbox.scoutrfp.com/v3/supplier\_classifications

-   Curl

Copy
